/* Core functions.

   This module is implicitly imported and all functions and types
   are always available.
   Some types and operations are required to be defined for the compiler
   to work correctly (i.e. types like `:exn` or `:list`)
*/
module std/corestd/core

pub import std/core/typesstd/core/types
pub import std/core/hndstd/core/hnd

pub infixr 80  (^)
pub infixl 70  (*), (%), (/), cdiv, cmod
pub infixl 60  (+), (-)
pub infix  40  (!=), (==), (<=), (>=), (<), (>)
// prefix     (!), (-)

extern import
  c  file "core/core-inline"
  cs file "core/core-inline.cs"
  js file "core/core-inline.js"

extern import
  js file "core/core-integer-inline.js"

extern import
  js file "core/core-string-inline.js"

extern import
  js file "core/core-console-inline.js"

// ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
// Builtin effects
// ----------------------------------------------------------------------------

// An alias for the empty effect.
// pub alias total = <>

// The console effect signifies that a function may write to the console.
pub type consolestd/core/console: X :: X

// An alias for pure effects: a pure function always returns the same result
// when called with the same arguments but may not terminate or raise an exception.
pub alias purestd/core/pure: E = <std/core/types/total: Eexnstd/core/exn: HX,divstd/core/types/div: X>

// The `:global-scope` is a special type constant to denote the global scope
pub type global-scopestd/core/global-scope: S :: S

// The `:net` effect signifies a function may access the network
pub type netstd/core/net: X :: X

// The `:fsys` effect signifies a function may access the file system
pub type fsysstd/core/fsys: X :: X

// The `:ui` effect signifies a function may access the graphics system
pub type uistd/core/ui: X :: X

// The `:blocking` effect signifies that a function may block
pub type blockingstd/core/blocking: X :: X

// The `:io-total` effect is used for functions that perform arbitrary I/O operations, but are terminating without raising exceptions.
pub alias io-totalstd/core/io-total: E = <std/core/types/total: Endetstd/core/types/ndet: X,consolestd/core/console: X,netstd/core/net: X,fsysstd/core/fsys: X,uistd/core/ui: X,ststd/core/types/st: H -> E<globalstd/core/types/global: H>>

// The `:io-noexn` effect is used for functions that perform arbitrary I/O operations, but raise no exceptions
pub alias io-noexnstd/core/io-noexn: E = <std/core/types/total: Edivstd/core/types/div: X,io-totalstd/core/io-total: E>

// The `:io` effect is used for functions that perform arbitrary I/O operations.
pub alias iostd/core/io: E = <std/core/types/total: Eexnstd/core/exn: HX,io-noexnstd/core/io-noexn: E>


// ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
// Masking
// ----------------------------------------------------------------------------

// Add the state effect to a function effect.
pub inline extern inject-ststd/core/inject-st: forall<a,h,e> (() -> e a) -> (() -> <st<h>|e> a) : forall<aa: V,hh: H,ee: E> (() -> ee: E aa: V) -> totalstd/core/types/total: E (() -> <ststd/core/types/st: H -> E<hh: H>|ee: E> aa: V)
  inline "#1"

// ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
// Standard Functions
// ----------------------------------------------------------------------------

// The `const` funs returns its first argument and ignores the second.
pub fun conststd/core/const: forall<a,b> (x : a, y : b) -> a(xx: _3361,yy: _3362)
  xx: _3361

// Apply a function `f` to a specified argument `x`.
pub fun applystd/core/apply: forall<a,b,e> (f : (a) -> e b, x : a) -> e b(ff: (_3208) -> _3209 _3210,xx: _3208)
  ff: (_3208) -> _3209 _3210(xx: _3208)

// Compose two funs `f` and `g`.
pub fun ostd/core/o: forall<a,b,c,e> (f : (a) -> e b, g : (c) -> e a) -> ((x : c) -> e b)(ff: (_4050) -> _4042 _4043,gg: (_4041) -> _4042 _4050)
  fnfn: (x : _4041) -> _4042 _4043(xx: _4041) ff: (_4050) -> _4042 _4043(gg: (_4041) -> _4042 _4050(xx: _4041))

// The `ignore` function ignores its argument.
pub fun ignorestd/core/ignore: forall<a> (x : a) -> ()( xx: $3759 : aa: V ) : (std/core/types/unit: V)std/core/types/unit: V
  (std/core/types/Unit: ())std/core/types/Unit: ()

// Return a 'constant' function that ignores its argument and always returns the same result
pub fun default/conststd/core/default/const: forall<a,b> (default : a) -> ((x : b) -> a)( defaultdefault: $15914 : aa: V ) : totalstd/core/types/total: E (( x : bb: V ) -> astd/core/types/total: E)
  fnfn: ($15915) -> $15914(_) defaultdefault: $15914

// ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
// Standard Data types
// ----------------------------------------------------------------------------

pub fip fun bool/intstd/core/bool/int: (b : bool) -> int( bb: bool : boolstd/core/types/bool: V ) : intstd/core/types/int: V
  if bb: bool then 1 else 0

pub fip fun mbintstd/core/mbint: (m : maybe<int>) -> int( mm: maybe<int> : maybestd/core/types/maybe: V -> V<intstd/core/types/int: V> ) : intstd/core/types/int: V
  match mm: maybe<int>
    Nothingstd/core/types/Nothing: forall<a> maybe<a> -> 0
    Juststd/core/types/Just: forall<a> (value : a) -> maybe<a>(ii: int) -> ii: int

// Convert an int to a boolean, using `False` for 0 and `True` otherwise.
pub fun int/boolstd/core/int/bool: (i : int) -> bool( ii: int : intstd/core/types/int: V ) : boolstd/core/types/bool: V
  ii: int !=std/core/int/(!=): (x : int, y : int) -> bool 0

// Convert a `:maybe` type to a boolean using `False` for `Nothing` and `True` for `Just`.
pub fun maybe/boolstd/core/maybe/bool: forall<a> (m : maybe<a>) -> bool( mm: maybe<$4672> : maybestd/core/types/maybe: V -> V<aa: V> ) : boolstd/core/types/bool: V
  match mm: maybe<$4672>
    Nothingstd/core/types/Nothing: forall<a> maybe<a> -> Falsestd/core/types/False: bool
    _       -> Truestd/core/types/True: bool

// Convert a string to a boolean, using `False` for the empty string and `True` otherwise.
pub fun string/boolstd/core/string/bool: (s : string) -> bool( ss: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V ) : boolstd/core/types/bool: V
  ss: string !=std/core/string/(!=): (string, string) -> bool ""

// Match a `:maybe` value and either return a default value on `Nothing` or apply a function to the value on `Just`
pub fun maybe/maybestd/core/maybe/maybe: forall<a,b,e> (m : maybe<a>, onNothing : b, onJust : (a) -> e b) -> e b( mm: maybe<$4328> : maybestd/core/types/maybe: V -> V<aa: V>, onNothingonNothing: $4329: bb: V, onJustonJust: ($4328) -> $4330 $4329: aa: V -> ee: E bb: V ) : ee: E bb: V
  match mm: maybe<$4328>
    Nothingstd/core/types/Nothing: forall<a> maybe<a> -> onNothingonNothing: $4329
    Juststd/core/types/Just: forall<a> (value : a) -> maybe<a>(xx: $4328) -> onJustonJust: ($4328) -> $4330 $4329(xx: $4328)

// Convert a `:maybe<a>` value to `:a`, using the `nothing` parameter for `Nothing`.
// This is an alias for `default`.
pub fun default/maybestd/core/default/maybe: forall<a> (m : maybe<a>, nothing : a) -> a( mm: maybe<$13660> : maybestd/core/types/maybe: V -> V<aa: V>, nothingnothing: $13660 : aa: V ) : astd/core/types/total: E
  defaultstd/core/default: (m : maybe<$13660>, nothing : $13660) -> $13660(mm: maybe<$13660>,nothingnothing: $13660)

// Convert a `:maybe<a>` value to `:a`, using the `nothing` parameter for `Nothing`.
pub fun defaultstd/core/default: forall<a> (m : maybe<a>, nothing : a) -> a( mm: maybe<$3381> : maybestd/core/types/maybe: V -> V<aa: V>, nothingnothing: $3381 : aa: V ) : astd/core/types/total: E
  match mm: maybe<$3381>
    Nothingstd/core/types/Nothing: forall<a> maybe<a> -> nothingnothing: $3381
    Juststd/core/types/Just: forall<a> (value : a) -> maybe<a>(xx: $3381) -> xx: $3381

// Get the value of the `Just` constructor or raise an exception
pub fun unjuststd/core/unjust: forall<a> (m : maybe<a>) -> exn a( mm: maybe<$14593> : maybestd/core/types/maybe: V -> V<aa: V> ) : exnstd/core/exn: HX aa: V
  match mm: maybe<$14593>
    Juststd/core/types/Just: forall<a> (value : a) -> maybe<a>(xx: $14593) -> xx: $14593
    Nothingstd/core/types/Nothing: forall<a> maybe<a> -> throwstd/core/throw: (message : string, info : ? exception-info) -> exn $14593("unexpected Nothing in std/core/unjust")

pub fun maybe/mapstd/core/maybe/map: forall<a,b,e> (m : maybe<a>, f : (a) -> e b) -> e maybe<b>( mm: maybe<$2629> : maybestd/core/types/maybe: V -> V<aa: V>, ff: ($2629) -> $2631 $2630 : aa: V -> ee: E bb: V ) : ee: E maybestd/core/types/maybe: V -> V<bb: V>
  match mm: maybe<$2629>
    Nothingstd/core/types/Nothing: forall<a> maybe<a> -> Nothingstd/core/types/Nothing: forall<a> maybe<a>
    Juststd/core/types/Just: forall<a> (value : a) -> maybe<a>(xx: $2629) -> Juststd/core/types/Just: forall<a> (value : a) -> maybe<a>(ff: ($2629) -> $2631 $2630(xx: $2629))

pub fun maybe/(||)std/core/maybe/(||): forall<a> (m1 : maybe<a>, m2 : maybe<a>) -> maybe<a>( m1m1: maybe<$2512> : maybestd/core/types/maybe: V -> V<aa: V>, m2m2: maybe<$2512>: maybestd/core/types/maybe: V -> V<aa: V> ) : maybestd/core/types/maybe: V -> V<aa: V>
  match m1m1: maybe<$2512>
    Nothingstd/core/types/Nothing: forall<a> maybe<a> -> m2m2: maybe<$2512>
    _       -> m1m1: maybe<$2512>

// Convert a `:either` to a `:maybe` type discarding the value of the `Left` constructor
// and using `Just` for the `Right` constructor.
pub fun either/maybestd/core/either/maybe: forall<a,b> (e : either<a,b>) -> maybe<b>( ee: either<$4236,$4237> : eitherstd/core/types/either: (V, V) -> V<aa: V,bb: V> ) : maybestd/core/types/maybe: V -> V<bb: V>
  match ee: either<$4236,$4237>
    Leftstd/core/types/Left: forall<a,b> (left : a) -> either<a,b> -> Nothingstd/core/types/Nothing: forall<a> maybe<a>
    Rightstd/core/types/Right: forall<a,b> (right : b) -> either<a,b>(xx: $4237) -> Juststd/core/types/Just: forall<a> (value : a) -> maybe<a>(xx: $4237)

// Map over the `Right` component of an `:either` type.
pub fun either/mapstd/core/either/map: forall<a,b,c,e> (e : either<a,b>, f : (b) -> e c) -> e either<a,c>( ee: either<$2569,$2570> : eitherstd/core/types/either: (V, V) -> V<aa: V,bb: V>, ff: ($2570) -> $2572 $2571 : bb: V -> ee: E cc: V  ) : ee: E eitherstd/core/types/either: (V, V) -> V<aa: V,cc: V>
  match ee: either<$2569,$2570>
    Rightstd/core/types/Right: forall<a,b> (right : b) -> either<a,b>(xx: $2570) -> Rightstd/core/types/Right: forall<a,b> (right : b) -> either<a,b>(ff: ($2570) -> $2572 $2571(xx: $2570))
    Leftstd/core/types/Left: forall<a,b> (left : a) -> either<a,b>(xx: $2569)  -> Leftstd/core/types/Left: forall<a,b> (left : a) -> either<a,b>(xx: $2569)

// The type of lists, which can be either empty (`Nil`) or an element followed
// by a list (`Cons`).
pub type liststd/core/list: V -> V<aa: V>
  // The empty list.
  con Nilstd/core/Nil: forall<a> list<a>                  // note: must come first; see Core/Core.hs
  // A ``head``  element followed by the ``tail``  of the list.
  con Consstd/core/Cons: forall<a> (head : a, tail : list<a>) -> list<a>(head:aa: V, tail : liststd/core/list: V -> V<aa: V> )

// Return the head of list if the list is not empty.
pub fun list/headstd/core/list/head: forall<a> (xs : list<a>) -> maybe<a>( xsxs: list<$4646> : liststd/core/list: V -> V<aa: V> ) : maybestd/core/types/maybe: V -> V<aa: V>
  match xsxs: list<$4646>
    Consstd/core/Cons: forall<a> (head : a, tail : list<a>) -> list<a>(xx: $4646) -> Juststd/core/types/Just: forall<a> (value : a) -> maybe<a>(xx: $4646)
    _       -> Nothingstd/core/types/Nothing: forall<a> maybe<a>

// Return the head of list if the list is not empty, or use `default` otherwise
pub fun default/headstd/core/default/head: forall<a> (xs : list<a>, default : a) -> a( xsxs: list<$15933> : liststd/core/list: V -> V<aa: V>, defaultdefault: $15933 : aa: V ) : astd/core/types/total: E
  match xsxs: list<$15933>
    Consstd/core/Cons: forall<a> (head : a, tail : list<a>) -> list<a>(xx: $15933) -> xx: $15933
    _       -> defaultdefault: $15933

// Return the tail of list. Returns the empty list if `xs` is empty.
pub fun tailstd/core/tail: forall<a> (xs : list<a>) -> list<a>( xsxs: list<$4411> : liststd/core/list: V -> V<aa: V> ) : liststd/core/list: V -> V<aa: V>
  match xsxs: list<$4411>
    Consstd/core/Cons: forall<a> (head : a, tail : list<a>) -> list<a>(_,xxxx: list<$4411>) -> xxxx: list<$4411>
    _          -> [std/core/Nil: forall<a> list<a>]std/core/Nil: forall<a> list<a>

// Is the list empty?
pub fun is-emptystd/core/is-empty: forall<a> (xs : list<a>) -> bool( xsxs: list<$2529> : liststd/core/list: V -> V<aa: V> ) : boolstd/core/types/bool: V
  match xsxs: list<$2529>
    Nilstd/core/Nil: forall<a> list<a> -> Truestd/core/types/True: bool
    _   -> Falsestd/core/types/False: bool

// A `:stream` is a co-inductive type representing an infinite list of elements.
pub co type streamstd/core/stream: V -> V<aa: V>
  con Nextstd/core/Next: forall<a> (head : a, tail : stream<a>) -> stream<a>(headstd/core/stream/head: forall<a> (stream : stream<a>) -> a:aa: V, tailstd/core/stream/tail: forall<a> (stream : stream<a>) -> stream<a>: streamstd/core/stream: V -> V<aa: V> )

pub fip fun order/intstd/core/order/int: (x : order) -> int( xx: order : orderstd/core/types/order: V ) : intstd/core/types/int: V
  match xx: order
    Ltstd/core/types/Lt: order -> -1
    Eqstd/core/types/Eq: order -> 0
    Gtstd/core/types/Gt: order -> 1

pub fun int/orderstd/core/int/order: (i : int) -> order( ii: int : intstd/core/types/int: V ) : orderstd/core/types/order: V
  if ii: int <std/core/int/(<): (x : int, y : int) -> bool 0 then Ltstd/core/types/Lt: order
  elif ii: int >std/core/int/(>): (x : int, y : int) -> bool 0 then Gtstd/core/types/Gt: order
  else Eqstd/core/types/Eq: order

pub fun order/(==)std/core/order/(==): (x : order, y : order) -> bool( xx: order : orderstd/core/types/order: V, yy: order : orderstd/core/types/order: V ) : boolstd/core/types/bool: V
  xx: order.intstd/core/order/int: (x : order) -> int ==std/core/int/(==): (x : int, y : int) -> bool yy: order.intstd/core/order/int: (x : order) -> int

pub fun order/(!=)std/core/order/(!=): (x : order, y : order) -> bool( xx: order : orderstd/core/types/order: V, yy: order : orderstd/core/types/order: V ) : boolstd/core/types/bool: V
  xx: order.intstd/core/order/int: (x : order) -> int !=std/core/int/(!=): (x : int, y : int) -> bool yy: order.intstd/core/order/int: (x : order) -> int

pub fun order/(>=)std/core/order/(>=): (x : order, y : order) -> bool( xx: order : orderstd/core/types/order: V, yy: order : orderstd/core/types/order: V ) : boolstd/core/types/bool: V
  xx: order.intstd/core/order/int: (x : order) -> int >=std/core/int/(>=): (x : int, y : int) -> bool yy: order.intstd/core/order/int: (x : order) -> int

pub fun order/(<=)std/core/order/(<=): (x : order, y : order) -> bool( xx: order : orderstd/core/types/order: V, yy: order : orderstd/core/types/order: V ) : boolstd/core/types/bool: V
  xx: order.intstd/core/order/int: (x : order) -> int <=std/core/int/(<=): (x : int, y : int) -> bool yy: order.intstd/core/order/int: (x : order) -> int

pub fun order/(>)std/core/order/(>): (x : order, y : order) -> bool( xx: order : orderstd/core/types/order: V, yy: order : orderstd/core/types/order: V ) : boolstd/core/types/bool: V
  xx: order.intstd/core/order/int: (x : order) -> int >std/core/int/(>): (x : int, y : int) -> bool yy: order.intstd/core/order/int: (x : order) -> int

pub fun order/(<)std/core/order/(<): (x : order, y : order) -> bool( xx: order : orderstd/core/types/order: V, yy: order : orderstd/core/types/order: V ) : boolstd/core/types/bool: V
  xx: order.intstd/core/order/int: (x : order) -> int <std/core/int/(<): (x : int, y : int) -> bool yy: order.intstd/core/order/int: (x : order) -> int

pub fun tuple2/mapstd/core/tuple2/map: forall<a,b,e> (t : (a, a), f : (a) -> e b) -> e (b, b)( tt: ($2748, $2748) : (std/core/types/tuple2: (V, V) -> Vaa: V,aa: V), ff: ($2748) -> $2750 $2749 : aa: V -> ee: E bb: V ) : ee: E (std/core/types/tuple2: (V, V) -> Vbb: V, bb: V)
  (std/core/types/Tuple2: forall<a,b> (fst : a, snd : b) -> (a, b)tt: ($2748, $2748).fststd/core/types/tuple2/fst: (tuple2 : ($2748, $2748)) -> $2750 $2748.ff: ($2748) -> $2750 $2749, tt: ($2748, $2748).sndstd/core/types/tuple2/snd: (tuple2 : ($2748, $2748)) -> $2750 $2748.ff: ($2748) -> $2750 $2749)std/core/types/Tuple2: forall<a,b> (fst : a, snd : b) -> (a, b)

pub fun tuple3/mapstd/core/tuple3/map: forall<a,b,e> (t : (a, a, a), f : (a) -> e b) -> e (b, b, b)( tt: ($2853, $2853, $2853) : (std/core/types/tuple3: (V, V, V) -> Vaa: V,aa: V,aa: V), ff: ($2853) -> $2855 $2854 : aa: V -> ee: E bb: V ) : ee: E (std/core/types/tuple3: (V, V, V) -> Vbb: V, bb: V, bb: V)
  (std/core/types/Tuple3: forall<a,b,c> (fst : a, snd : b, thd : c) -> (a, b, c)tt: ($2853, $2853, $2853).fststd/core/types/tuple3/fst: (tuple3 : ($2853, $2853, $2853)) -> $2855 $2853.ff: ($2853) -> $2855 $2854, tt: ($2853, $2853, $2853).sndstd/core/types/tuple3/snd: (tuple3 : ($2853, $2853, $2853)) -> $2855 $2853.ff: ($2853) -> $2855 $2854, tt: ($2853, $2853, $2853).thdstd/core/types/tuple3/thd: (tuple3 : ($2853, $2853, $2853)) -> $2855 $2853.ff: ($2853) -> $2855 $2854)std/core/types/Tuple3: forall<a,b,c> (fst : a, snd : b, thd : c) -> (a, b, c)

pub fun tuple4/mapstd/core/tuple4/map: forall<a,b,e> (t : (a, a, a, a), f : (a) -> e b) -> e (b, b, b, b)( tt: ($3000, $3000, $3000, $3000) : (std/core/types/tuple4: (V, V, V, V) -> Vaa: V,aa: V,aa: V,aa: V), ff: ($3000) -> $3002 $3001 : aa: V -> ee: E bb: V ) : ee: E (std/core/types/tuple4: (V, V, V, V) -> Vbb: V,bb: V,bb: V,bb: V)
  (std/core/types/Tuple4: forall<a,b,c,d> (fst : a, snd : b, thd : c, field4 : d) -> (a, b, c, d)tt: ($3000, $3000, $3000, $3000).fststd/core/types/tuple4/fst: (tuple4 : ($3000, $3000, $3000, $3000)) -> $3002 $3000.ff: ($3000) -> $3002 $3001, tt: ($3000, $3000, $3000, $3000).sndstd/core/types/tuple4/snd: (tuple4 : ($3000, $3000, $3000, $3000)) -> $3002 $3000.ff: ($3000) -> $3002 $3001, tt: ($3000, $3000, $3000, $3000).thdstd/core/types/tuple4/thd: (tuple4 : ($3000, $3000, $3000, $3000)) -> $3002 $3000.ff: ($3000) -> $3002 $3001, tt: ($3000, $3000, $3000, $3000).field4std/core/types/tuple4/field4: (tuple4 : ($3000, $3000, $3000, $3000)) -> $3002 $3000.ff: ($3000) -> $3002 $3001)std/core/types/Tuple4: forall<a,b,c,d> (fst : a, snd : b, thd : c, field4 : d) -> (a, b, c, d)


// ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
// List functions
// ----------------------------------------------------------------------------

// Returns a singleton list.
pub fun singlestd/core/single: forall<a> (x : a) -> list<a>(xx: _4393)
  [std/core/Cons: forall<a> (head : a, tail : list<a>) -> list<a>xx: _4393]std/core/Nil: forall<a> list<a>

// Returns the length of a list.
pub fun list/lengthstd/core/list/length: forall<a> (xs : list<a>) -> int(xsxs: list<_6627>)
  fun lenlen: forall<a> (ys : list<a>, acc : int) -> int(ysys: list<_6607>,accacc: int)
    match ysys: list<_6607>
      Consstd/core/Cons: forall<a> (head : a, tail : list<a>) -> list<a>(_,yyyy: list<_6607>) -> yyyy: list<_6607>.lenlen: (ys : list<_6607>, acc : int) -> int(accacc: int+std/core/int/(+): (x : int, y : int) -> int1)
      Nilstd/core/Nil: forall<a> list<a>        -> accacc: int
  xsxs: list<_6627>.lenlen: (ys : list<_6627>, acc : int) -> int(0)

// Returns an integer list of increasing elements from `lo`  to `hi`
// (including both `lo`  and `hi` ).
// If `lo > hi`  the function returns the empty list.
pub fun liststd/core/list: (lo : int, hi : int) -> list<int>( lolo: int: intstd/core/types/int: V, hihi: int: intstd/core/types/int: V ) : totalstd/core/types/total: E liststd/core/list: V -> V<intstd/core/types/int: V>
  if lolo: int <=std/core/int/(<=): (x : int, y : int) -> bool hihi: int
    then Consstd/core/Cons: forall<a> (head : a, tail : list<a>) -> list<a>( lolo: int, liststd/core/list: (lo : int, hi : int) -> list<int>( unsafe-decreasingstd/core/types/unsafe-decreasing: (x : int) -> int(lolo: int.incstd/core/int/inc: (i : int) -> int), hihi: int ) )
    else Nilstd/core/Nil: forall<a> list<a>

// Returns an integer list of increasing elements from `lo`  to `hi` with stride `stride`.
// If `lo > hi`  the function returns the empty list.
pub fun stride/liststd/core/stride/list: (lo : int, hi : int, stride : int) -> list<int>( lolo: int: intstd/core/types/int: V, hihi: int: intstd/core/types/int: V, stridestride: int : intstd/core/types/int: V ) : totalstd/core/types/total: E liststd/core/list: V -> V<intstd/core/types/int: V>
  if lolo: int <=std/core/int/(<=): (x : int, y : int) -> bool hihi: int
    then Consstd/core/Cons: forall<a> (head : a, tail : list<a>) -> list<a>( lolo: int, liststd/core/stride/list: (lo : int, hi : int, stride : int) -> list<int>(  unsafe-decreasingstd/core/types/unsafe-decreasing: (x : int) -> int(lolo: int +std/core/int/(+): (x : int, y : int) -> int stridestride: int), hihi: int, stridestride: int ))
    else Nilstd/core/Nil: forall<a> list<a>

// Applies a function `f` to list of increasing elements from `lo`  to `hi`
// (including both `lo`  and `hi` ).
// If `lo > hi`  the function returns the empty list.
pub fun function/liststd/core/function/list: forall<a,e> (lo : int, hi : int, f : (int) -> e a) -> e list<a>( lolo: int: intstd/core/types/int: V, hihi: int: intstd/core/types/int: V, ff: (int) -> $8773 $8772 : intstd/core/types/int: V -> ee: E aa: V ) : ee: E liststd/core/list: V -> V<aa: V>
  if lolo: int <=std/core/int/(<=): (x : int, y : int) -> $8773 bool hihi: int
    then Consstd/core/Cons: forall<a> (head : a, tail : list<a>) -> list<a>( ff: (int) -> $8773 $8772(lolo: int), liststd/core/function/list: (lo : int, hi : int, f : (int) -> $8773 $8772) -> $8773 list<$8772>( unsafe-decreasingstd/core/types/unsafe-decreasing: (x : int) -> $8773 int(lolo: int.incstd/core/int/inc: (i : int) -> $8773 int), hihi: int, ff: (int) -> $8773 $8772 ))
    else Nilstd/core/Nil: forall<a> list<a>

// Create a list of characters from `lo`  to `hi`  (inclusive).

// Zip two lists together by pairing the corresponding elements.
// The returned list is only as long as the smallest input list.
pub fun zipstd/core/zip: forall<a,b> (xs : list<a>, ys : list<b>) -> list<(a, b)>( xsxs: list<$15581> : liststd/core/list: V -> V<aa: V>, ysys: list<$15582> : liststd/core/list: V -> V<bb: V> ) : liststd/core/list: V -> V<(std/core/types/tuple2: (V, V) -> Vaa: V,bb: V)>

    Consstd/core/Cons: forall<a> (head : a, tail : list<a>) -> list<a>(xx: $15581,xxxx: list<$15581>) -> match ysys: list<$15582>
      Consstd/core/Cons: forall<a> (head : a, tail : list<a>) -> list<a>(yy: $15582,yyyy: list<$15582>) -> Consstd/core/Cons: forall<a> (head : a, tail : list<a>) -> list<a>((std/core/types/Tuple2: forall<a,b> (fst : a, snd : b) -> (a, b)xx: $15581,yy: $15582)std/core/types/Tuple2: forall<a,b> (fst : a, snd : b) -> (a, b),zipstd/core/zip: (xs : list<$15581>, ys : list<$15582>) -> list<($15581, $15582)>(xxxx: list<$15581>,yyyy: list<$15582>))
      Nilstd/core/Nil: forall<a> list<a>        -> Nilstd/core/Nil: forall<a> list<a>
    Nilstd/core/Nil: forall<a> list<a> -> Nilstd/core/Nil: forall<a> list<a>

// Zip two lists together by apply a function `f` to all corresponding elements.
// The returned list is only as long as the smallest input list.

// Take the first `n` elements of a list (or fewer if the list is shorter than `n`)
pub fun list/takestd/core/list/take: forall<a> (xs : list<a>, n : int) -> list<a>( xsxs: list<$12728> : liststd/core/list: V -> V<aa: V>, nn: int : intstd/core/types/int: V ) : liststd/core/list: V -> V<aa: V>
  match xsxs: list<$12728>
    Consstd/core/Cons: forall<a> (head : a, tail : list<a>) -> list<a>(xx: $12728,xxxx: list<$12728>) | nn: int >std/core/int/(>): (x : int, y : int) -> bool 0 -> Consstd/core/Cons: forall<a> (head : a, tail : list<a>) -> list<a>(xx: $12728, takestd/core/list/take: (xs : list<$12728>, n : int) -> list<$12728>(xxxx: list<$12728>, nn: int -std/core/int/(-): (x : int, y : int) -> int 1))
    _ -> Nilstd/core/Nil: forall<a> list<a>

// Drop the first `n` elements of a list (or fewer if the list is shorter than `n`)
pub fun list/dropstd/core/list/drop: forall<a> (xs : list<a>, n : int) -> list<a>( xsxs: list<$12654> : liststd/core/list: V -> V<aa: V>, nn: int : intstd/core/types/int: V ) : liststd/core/list: V -> V<aa: V>
  match xsxs: list<$12654>
    Consstd/core/Cons: forall<a> (head : a, tail : list<a>) -> list<a>(_,xxxx: list<$12654>) | nn: int >std/core/int/(>): (x : int, y : int) -> bool 0 -> dropstd/core/list/drop: (xs : list<$12654>, n : int) -> list<$12654>(xxxx: list<$12654>, nn: int -std/core/int/(-): (x : int, y : int) -> int 1)
    _ -> xsxs: list<$12654>

// Apply a function `f`  to each element of the input list in sequence.
pub fun list/mapstd/core/list/map: forall<a,b,e> (xs : list<a>, f : (a) -> e b) -> e list<b>(xsxs: list<$8572> : liststd/core/list: V -> V<aa: V>, ff: ($8572) -> $8574 $8573 : aa: V -> ee: E bb: V) : ee: E liststd/core/list: V -> V<bb: V>
  match xsxs: list<$8572>
    Consstd/core/Cons: forall<a> (head : a, tail : list<a>) -> list<a>(xx: $8572,xxxx: list<$8572>) -> Consstd/core/Cons: forall<a> (head : a, tail : list<a>) -> list<a>(ff: ($8572) -> $8574 $8573(xx: $8572), xxxx: list<$8572>.mapstd/core/list/map: (xs : list<$8572>, f : ($8572) -> $8574 $8573) -> $8574 list<$8573>(ff: ($8572) -> $8574 $8573))

// Apply a function `f`  to each element of the input list in sequence where takes
// both the index of the current element and the element itself as arguments.

// Reverse a list.

// Efficiently reverse a list `xs` and append it to `tl`:
// `reverse-append(xs,tl) == reserve(xs) ++ tl
pub fun reverse-appendstd/core/reverse-append: forall<a> (xs : list<a>, tl : list<a>) -> list<a>( xsxs: list<$3547> : liststd/core/list: V -> V<aa: V>, tltl: list<$3547> : liststd/core/list: V -> V<aa: V> ) : liststd/core/list: V -> V<aa: V>

      Consstd/core/Cons: forall<a> (head : a, tail : list<a>) -> list<a>(xx: $3548,xxxx: list<$3548>) -> reverse-accreverse-acc: (acc : list<$3548>, ys : list<$3548>) -> list<$3548>(Consstd/core/Cons: forall<a> (head : a, tail : list<a>) -> list<a>(xx: $3548,accacc: list<$3548>),xxxx: list<$3548>)
      _          -> accacc: list<$3548>
  reverse-accreverse-acc: (acc : list<$3547>, ys : list<$3547>) -> list<$3547>(tltl: list<$3547>,xsxs: list<$3547>)

// Fold a list from the right, i.e. `foldr([1,2],0,(+)) == 1+(2+0)`
// Note, `foldr` is less efficient than `foldl` as it reverses the list first.
pub fun foldrstd/core/foldr: forall<a,b,e> (xs : list<a>, z : b, f : (a, b) -> e b) -> e b(xsxs: list<$11603> : liststd/core/list: V -> V<aa: V>, zz: $11604 : bb: V, ff: ($11603, $11604) -> $11605 $11604 : (aa: V, bb: V) -> ee: E bb: V) : ee: E bb: V
  xsxs: list<$11603>.reversestd/core/reverse: (xs : list<$11603>) -> $11605 list<$11603>.foldlstd/core/foldl: (xs : list<$11603>, z : $11604, f : ($11604, $11603) -> $11605 $11604) -> $11605 $11604(zz: $11604) fnfn: (x : $11604, y : $11603) -> $11605 $11604(xx: $11604,yy: $11603) ff: ($11603, $11604) -> $11605 $11604(yy: $11603,xx: $11604)

// Fold a list from the left, i.e. `foldl([1,2],0,(+)) == (0+1)+2`
// Since `foldl` is tail recursive, it is preferred over `foldr` when using an associative function `f`
pub fun foldlstd/core/foldl: forall<a,b,e> (xs : list<a>, z : b, f : (b, a) -> e b) -> e b(xsxs: list<$11488> : liststd/core/list: V -> V<aa: V>, zz: $11489 : bb: V, ff: ($11489, $11488) -> $11490 $11489 : (bb: V, aa: V) -> ee: E bb: V) : ee: E bb: V
  match xsxs: list<$11488>
    Consstd/core/Cons: forall<a> (head : a, tail : list<a>) -> list<a>(xx: $11488,xxxx: list<$11488>) -> foldlstd/core/foldl: (xs : list<$11488>, z : $11489, f : ($11489, $11488) -> $11490 $11489) -> $11490 $11489(xxxx: list<$11488>,ff: ($11489, $11488) -> $11490 $11489(zz: $11489,xx: $11488),ff: ($11489, $11488) -> $11490 $11489)
    Nilstd/core/Nil: forall<a> list<a>        -> zz: $11489

// Retain only those elements of a list that satisfy the given predicate `pred`.

// Remove those elements of a list that satisfy the given predicate `pred`.

// Partition a list in two lists where the first list contains
// those elements that satisfy the given predicate `pred`.
// For example: `partition([1,2,3],odd?) == ([1,3],[2])`

// Retain only those elements of a list that satisfy the given predicate `pred`.
// For example: `filterMap([1,2,3],fn(i) { if i.odd? then Nothing else Just(i*i) }) == [4]`
pub fun filter-mapstd/core/filter-map: forall<a,b,e> (xs : list<a>, pred : (a) -> e maybe<b>) -> e list<b>( xsxs: list<$11212> : liststd/core/list: V -> V<aa: V>, predpred: ($11212) -> $11214 maybe<$11213> : aa: V -> ee: E maybestd/core/types/maybe: V -> V<bb: V> ) : ee: E liststd/core/list: V -> V<bb: V>
  match xsxs: list<$11212>
    Nilstd/core/Nil: forall<a> list<a> -> Nilstd/core/Nil: forall<a> list<a>
    Consstd/core/Cons: forall<a> (head : a, tail : list<a>) -> list<a>(xx: $11212,xxxx: list<$11212>) -> match predpred: ($11212) -> $11214 maybe<$11213>(xx: $11212)
      Nothingstd/core/types/Nothing: forall<a> maybe<a> -> xxxx: list<$11212>.filter-mapstd/core/filter-map: (xs : list<$11212>, pred : ($11212) -> $11214 maybe<$11213>) -> $11214 list<$11213>(predpred: ($11212) -> $11214 maybe<$11213>)
      Juststd/core/types/Just: forall<a> (value : a) -> maybe<a>(yy: $11213) -> Consstd/core/Cons: forall<a> (head : a, tail : list<a>) -> list<a>(yy: $11213,xxxx: list<$11212>.filter-mapstd/core/filter-map: (xs : list<$11212>, pred : ($11212) -> $11214 maybe<$11213>) -> $11214 list<$11213>(predpred: ($11212) -> $11214 maybe<$11213>))

// Convert a list to a `:maybe` type, using `Nothing` for an empty list, and otherwise `Just` on the head element.
// Note: this is just `head`.
pub fun list/maybestd/core/list/maybe: forall<a> (xs : list<a>) -> maybe<a>( xsxs: list<$4301> : liststd/core/list: V -> V<aa: V> ) : maybestd/core/types/maybe: V -> V<aa: V>
  match xsxs: list<$4301>
    Nilstd/core/Nil: forall<a> list<a> -> Nothingstd/core/types/Nothing: forall<a> maybe<a>
    Consstd/core/Cons: forall<a> (head : a, tail : list<a>) -> list<a>(xx: $4301,_) -> Juststd/core/types/Just: forall<a> (value : a) -> maybe<a>(xx: $4301)

// Convert a `:maybe` type to a list type.
pub fun maybe/liststd/core/maybe/list: forall<a> (m : maybe<a>) -> list<a>( mm: maybe<$2669> : maybestd/core/types/maybe: V -> V<aa: V> ) : liststd/core/list: V -> V<aa: V>
  match mm: maybe<$2669>
    Nothingstd/core/types/Nothing: forall<a> maybe<a> -> Nilstd/core/Nil: forall<a> list<a>
    Juststd/core/types/Just: forall<a> (value : a) -> maybe<a>(xx: $2669) -> Consstd/core/Cons: forall<a> (head : a, tail : list<a>) -> list<a>(xx: $2669,Nilstd/core/Nil: forall<a> list<a>)

    Nilstd/core/Nil: forall<a> list<a>        -> -1


// Returns the index of the first element where `pred` holds, or `-1` if no such element exists.

// Invoke `action` for each element of a list while `action` return `Nothing`
pub fun foreach-whilestd/core/foreach-while: forall<a,b,e> (xs : list<a>, action : (a) -> e maybe<b>) -> e maybe<b>( xsxs: list<$7827> : liststd/core/list: V -> V<aa: V>, actionaction: ($7827) -> $7829 maybe<$7828> : (aa: V) -> ee: E maybestd/core/types/maybe: V -> V<bb: V> ) : ee: E maybestd/core/types/maybe: V -> V<bb: V>

    Nilstd/core/Nil: forall<a> list<a>        -> Nothingstd/core/types/Nothing: forall<a> maybe<a>
    Consstd/core/Cons: forall<a> (head : a, tail : list<a>) -> list<a>(xx: $7827,xxxx: list<$7827>) ->
      match actionaction: ($7827) -> $7829 maybe<$7828>(xx: $7827)
        Nothingstd/core/types/Nothing: forall<a> maybe<a> -> xxxx: list<$7827>.foreach-whilestd/core/foreach-while: (xs : list<$7827>, action : ($7827) -> $7829 maybe<$7828>) -> $7829 maybe<$7828>(actionaction: ($7827) -> $7829 maybe<$7828>)
        justjust: maybe<$7828>    -> justjust: maybe<$7828>

// Invoke `action` on each element of a list while `action` returns `Just`
pub fun map-whilestd/core/map-while: forall<a,b,e> (xs : list<a>, action : (a) -> e maybe<b>) -> e list<b>( xsxs: list<$13145> : liststd/core/list: V -> V<aa: V>, actionaction: ($13145) -> $13147 maybe<$13146> : (aa: V) -> ee: E maybestd/core/types/maybe: V -> V<bb: V> ) : ee: E liststd/core/list: V -> V<bb: V>

    Consstd/core/Cons: forall<a> (head : a, tail : list<a>) -> list<a>(xx: $13145,xxxx: list<$13145>) ->
      match actionaction: ($13145) -> $13147 maybe<$13146>(xx: $13145)
        Juststd/core/types/Just: forall<a> (value : a) -> maybe<a>(yy: $13146) -> Consstd/core/Cons: forall<a> (head : a, tail : list<a>) -> list<a>(yy: $13146,xxxx: list<$13145>.map-whilestd/core/map-while: (xs : list<$13145>, action : ($13145) -> $13147 maybe<$13146>) -> $13147 list<$13146>(actionaction: ($13145) -> $13147 maybe<$13146>))
        Nothingstd/core/types/Nothing: forall<a> maybe<a> -> Nilstd/core/Nil: forall<a> list<a>


// Invoke `action` for each element of a list, passing also the position of the element.

  var ii: local-var<$11753,int> := 0
  xsxs: list<$11743>.foreachstd/core/foreach: (xs : list<$11743>, action : ($11743) -> <local<$11753>|$11744> ()) -> <local<$11753>|$11744> () fnfn: (x : $11743) -> <local<$11753>|$11744> ()(xx: $11743)
    val jj: int = ii: int // don't dereference `i` inside the inject

// Insert a separator `sep`  between all elements of a list `xs` .

// Concatenate all strings in a list
fun joinsepstd/core/joinsep: (xs : list<string>, sep : string) -> string( xsxs: list<string> : liststd/core/list: V -> V<stringstd/core/types/string: V>, sepsep: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V ) : stringstd/core/types/string: V
  fun join-accjoin-acc: (ys : list<string>, acc : string) -> string( ysys: list<string> : liststd/core/list: V -> V<stringstd/core/types/string: V>, accacc: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V )
    match ysys: list<string>
      Consstd/core/Cons: forall<a> (head : a, tail : list<a>) -> list<a>(yy: string,yyyy: list<string>) -> join-accjoin-acc: (ys : list<string>, acc : string) -> string(yyyy: list<string>, accacc: string ++std/core/string/(++): (x : string, y : string) -> string sepsep: string ++std/core/string/(++): (x : string, y : string) -> string yy: string)  // todo: use string builder
      Nilstd/core/Nil: forall<a> list<a> -> accacc: string
  match xsxs: list<string>
    Nilstd/core/Nil: forall<a> list<a> -> ""
    Consstd/core/Cons: forall<a> (head : a, tail : list<a>) -> list<a>(xx: string,xxxx: list<string>) -> join-accjoin-acc: (ys : list<string>, acc : string) -> string(xxxx: list<string>,xx: string)

// Concatenate all strings in a list
pub fun joinstd/core/join: (xs : list<string>) -> string( xsxs: list<string> : liststd/core/list: V -> V<stringstd/core/types/string: V> ) : stringstd/core/types/string: V
  xsxs: list<string>.joinsepstd/core/joinsep: (xs : list<string>, sep : string) -> string("")

// Concatenate all strings in a list using a specific separator
pub fun joinsep/joinstd/core/joinsep/join: (xs : list<string>, sep : string) -> string( xsxs: list<string> : liststd/core/list: V -> V<stringstd/core/types/string: V>, sepsep: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V ) : stringstd/core/types/string: V
  xsxs: list<string>.joinsepstd/core/joinsep: (xs : list<string>, sep : string) -> string(sepsep: string)

// Concatenate all strings in a list in reverse order
pub fun reverse-joinstd/core/reverse-join: (xs : list<string>) -> string( xsxs: list<string> : liststd/core/list: V -> V<stringstd/core/types/string: V> ) : stringstd/core/types/string: V
  xsxs: list<string>.reversestd/core/reverse: (xs : list<string>) -> list<string>.joinsepstd/core/joinsep: (xs : list<string>, sep : string) -> string("")

// Append `end` to each string in the list `xs` and join them all together.\
// `join-end([],end) === ""`\
// `join-end(["a","b"],"/") === "a/b/"`
pub fun join-endstd/core/join-end: (xs : list<string>, end : string) -> string( xsxs: list<string> : liststd/core/list: V -> V<stringstd/core/types/string: V>, endend: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V) : stringstd/core/types/string: V
  match xsxs: list<string>
    Nilstd/core/Nil: forall<a> list<a> -> ""
    _   -> xsxs: list<string>.joinsepstd/core/joinsep: (xs : list<string>, sep : string) -> string(endend: string) ++std/core/string/(++): (x : string, y : string) -> string endend: string

// Concatenate all lists in a list (e.g. flatten the list). (tail-recursive)

      Consstd/core/Cons: forall<a> (head : a, tail : list<a>) -> list<a>(yy: $3288,yyyy: list<$3288>) -> Consstd/core/Cons: forall<a> (head : a, tail : list<a>) -> list<a>(yy: $3288,concat-preconcat-pre: (ys : list<$3288>, zss : list<list<$3288>>) -> list<$3288>(yyyy: list<$3288>,zsszss: list<list<$3288>>))

// Concatenate the result lists from applying a function to all elements.

// Concatenate the `Just` result elements from applying a function to all elements.
pub fun flatmap-maybestd/core/flatmap-maybe: forall<a,b,e> (xs : list<a>, f : (a) -> e maybe<b>) -> e list<b>( xsxs: list<$11417> : liststd/core/list: V -> V<aa: V>, ff: ($11417) -> $11419 maybe<$11418> : aa: V -> ee: E maybestd/core/types/maybe: V -> V<bb: V> ) : ee: E liststd/core/list: V -> V<bb: V>

    Consstd/core/Cons: forall<a> (head : a, tail : list<a>) -> list<a>(xx: $11417,xxxx: list<$11417>) -> match ff: ($11417) -> $11419 maybe<$11418>(xx: $11417)
      Juststd/core/types/Just: forall<a> (value : a) -> maybe<a>(yy: $11418) -> Consstd/core/Cons: forall<a> (head : a, tail : list<a>) -> list<a>(yy: $11418, xxxx: list<$11417>.flatmap-maybestd/core/flatmap-maybe: (xs : list<$11417>, f : ($11417) -> $11419 maybe<$11418>) -> $11419 list<$11418>(ff: ($11417) -> $11419 maybe<$11418>))
      Nothingstd/core/types/Nothing: forall<a> maybe<a> -> xxxx: list<$11417>.flatmap-maybestd/core/flatmap-maybe: (xs : list<$11417>, f : ($11417) -> $11419 maybe<$11418>) -> $11419 list<$11418>(ff: ($11417) -> $11419 maybe<$11418>)
    Nilstd/core/Nil: forall<a> list<a> -> Nilstd/core/Nil: forall<a> list<a>

// Concatenate a list of `:maybe` values
pub fun concat-maybestd/core/concat-maybe: forall<a> (xs : list<maybe<a>>) -> list<a>( xsxs: list<maybe<$10787>> : liststd/core/list: V -> V<maybestd/core/types/maybe: V -> V<aa: V>> ) : liststd/core/list: V -> V<aa: V>
  match xsxs: list<maybe<$10787>>
    Consstd/core/Cons: forall<a> (head : a, tail : list<a>) -> list<a>(xx: maybe<$10787>,xxxx: list<maybe<$10787>>) -> match xx: maybe<$10787>
      Juststd/core/types/Just: forall<a> (value : a) -> maybe<a>(yy: $10787) -> Consstd/core/Cons: forall<a> (head : a, tail : list<a>) -> list<a>(yy: $10787, xxxx: list<maybe<$10787>>.concat-maybestd/core/concat-maybe: (xs : list<maybe<$10787>>) -> list<$10787>)

    Nilstd/core/Nil: forall<a> list<a> -> Nilstd/core/Nil: forall<a> list<a>

// Generic greater than
pub fun cmp/(>)std/core/cmp/(>): forall<a> (x : a, y : a, @implicit/cmp : (a, a) -> order) -> bool(xx: $4848 : aa: V, yy: $4848 : aa: V, @implicit/cmp@implicit/cmp: ($4848, $4848) -> order : (aa: V,aa: V) -> orderstd/core/types/order: V ) : boolstd/core/types/bool: V

// Generic lower than

// Generic greater than or equal
pub fun cmp/(>=)std/core/cmp/(>=): forall<a> (x : a, y : a, @implicit/cmp : (a, a) -> order) -> bool(xx: $7333 : aa: V, yy: $7333 : aa: V, @implicit/cmp@implicit/cmp: ($7333, $7333) -> order : (aa: V,aa: V) -> orderstd/core/types/order: V ) : boolstd/core/types/bool: V
  yy: $7333 <std/core/cmp/(<): (x : $7333, y : $7333, @implicit/cmp : ($7333, $7333) -> order) -> bool
?cmp=?cmp xx: $7333

// Generic lower than or equal

// ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
// Characters
// ----------------------------------------------------------------------------

pub inline fip extern char/(==)std/core/char/(==): (char, char) -> bool : (charstd/core/types/char: V,charstd/core/types/char: V) -> boolstd/core/types/bool: V
  inline "(#1 == #2)"
  js inline "(#1 === #2)"

pub inline fip extern char/(!=)std/core/char/(!=): (char, char) -> bool : (charstd/core/types/char: V,charstd/core/types/char: V) -> boolstd/core/types/bool: V
  inline "(#1 != #2)"
  js inline "(#1 !== #2)"

pub inline fip extern char/(<=)std/core/char/(<=): (char, char) -> bool : (charstd/core/types/char: V,charstd/core/types/char: V) -> boolstd/core/types/bool: V
  inline "(#1 <= #2)"

pub inline fip extern char/(>=)std/core/char/(>=): (char, char) -> bool : (charstd/core/types/char: V,charstd/core/types/char: V) -> boolstd/core/types/bool: V
  inline "(#1 >= #2)"

pub inline fip extern char/(<)std/core/char/(<): (char, char) -> bool  : (charstd/core/types/char: V,charstd/core/types/char: V) -> boolstd/core/types/bool: V
  inline "(#1 < #2)"

pub inline fip extern char/(>)std/core/char/(>): (char, char) -> bool  : (charstd/core/types/char: V,charstd/core/types/char: V) -> boolstd/core/types/bool: V
  inline "(#1 > #2)"

pub fip fun char/cmpstd/core/char/cmp: (x : char, y : char) -> order( xx: char : charstd/core/types/char: V, yy: char : charstd/core/types/char: V ) : orderstd/core/types/order: V
  if xx: char <std/core/char/(<): (char, char) -> bool yy: char then Ltstd/core/types/Lt: order
  elif xx: char >std/core/char/(>): (char, char) -> bool yy: char then Gtstd/core/types/Gt: order
  else Eqstd/core/types/Eq: order

// Convert a character to its unicode code point
pub inline fip extern char/intstd/core/char/int: (char) -> int : (charstd/core/types/char: V) -> intstd/core/types/int: V
  inline "#1"
  c "kk_integer_from_int"
  cs inline "new BigInteger(#1)"

// Convert a unicode code point to a character
pub inline fip extern int/charstd/core/int/char: (i : int) -> char( i : intstd/core/types/int: V) : charstd/core/types/char: V
  inline "(#1)"
  c "kk_integer_clamp32"
  cs inline "Primitive.IntToInt32(#1)"

// Add two character code points
pub fip fun char/(+)std/core/char/(+): (c : char, d : char) -> char(cc: char : charstd/core/types/char: V, dd: char : charstd/core/types/char: V) : totalstd/core/types/total: E charstd/core/types/char: V
  (cc: char.intstd/core/char/int: (char) -> int +std/core/int/(+): (x : int, y : int) -> int dd: char.intstd/core/char/int: (char) -> int).charstd/core/int/char: (i : int) -> char

// Substract two character codePoints
pub fip fun char/(-)std/core/char/(-): (c : char, d : char) -> char(cc: char : charstd/core/types/char: V, dd: char : charstd/core/types/char: V) : totalstd/core/types/total: E charstd/core/types/char: V
  (cc: char.intstd/core/char/int: (char) -> int -std/core/int/(-): (x : int, y : int) -> int dd: char.intstd/core/char/int: (char) -> int).charstd/core/int/char: (i : int) -> char

// Is the character a lower-case ASCII character ?
pub fip fun is-lowerstd/core/is-lower: (c : char) -> bool( cc: char : charstd/core/types/char: V ) : boolstd/core/types/bool: V
  cc: char >=std/core/char/(>=): (char, char) -> bool 'a' &&std/core/types/(&&): (x : bool, y : bool) -> bool cc: char <=std/core/char/(<=): (char, char) -> bool 'z'

// Is the character an upper-case ASCII character ?
pub fip fun is-upperstd/core/is-upper: (c : char) -> bool( cc: char : charstd/core/types/char: V ) : boolstd/core/types/bool: V
  cc: char >=std/core/char/(>=): (char, char) -> bool 'A' &&std/core/types/(&&): (x : bool, y : bool) -> bool cc: char <=std/core/char/(<=): (char, char) -> bool 'Z'

// Is the character an ASCII digit ?
pub fip fun is-digitstd/core/is-digit: (c : char) -> bool( cc: char : charstd/core/types/char: V ) : boolstd/core/types/bool: V
  cc: char >=std/core/char/(>=): (char, char) -> bool '0' &&std/core/types/(&&): (x : bool, y : bool) -> bool cc: char <=std/core/char/(<=): (char, char) -> bool '9'

// Is the character an ASCII hexa-decimal digit ?
pub fip fun is-hex-digitstd/core/is-hex-digit: (c : char) -> bool( cc: char : charstd/core/types/char: V ) : boolstd/core/types/bool: V
  cc: char.is-digitstd/core/is-digit: (c : char) -> bool ||std/core/types/(||): (x : bool, y : bool) -> bool (cc: char >=std/core/char/(>=): (char, char) -> bool 'a' &&std/core/types/(&&): (x : bool, y : bool) -> bool cc: char <=std/core/char/(<=): (char, char) -> bool 'f') ||std/core/types/(||): (x : bool, y : bool) -> bool (cc: char >=std/core/char/(>=): (char, char) -> bool 'A'  &&std/core/types/(&&): (x : bool, y : bool) -> bool cc: char <=std/core/char/(<=): (char, char) -> bool 'F')

// Is the character an ASCII letter is-
pub fip fun is-alphastd/core/is-alpha: (c : char) -> bool( cc: char : charstd/core/types/char: V ) : boolstd/core/types/bool: V
  cc: char.is-lowerstd/core/is-lower: (c : char) -> bool ||std/core/types/(||): (x : bool, y : bool) -> bool cc: char.is-upperstd/core/is-upper: (c : char) -> bool

// Is the character ASCII letter or digit?
pub fip fun is-alpha-numstd/core/is-alpha-num: (c : char) -> bool( cc: char : charstd/core/types/char: V ) : boolstd/core/types/bool: V
  cc: char.is-alphastd/core/is-alpha: (c : char) -> bool ||std/core/types/(||): (x : bool, y : bool) -> bool cc: char.is-digitstd/core/is-digit: (c : char) -> bool

// Is the character an ASCII character, e.g. `c <= '\x7F'`  ?
pub fip fun is-asciistd/core/is-ascii: (c : char) -> bool( cc: char : charstd/core/types/char: V )     : boolstd/core/types/bool: V
  cc: char <=std/core/char/(<=): (char, char) -> bool '\DEL'

// Is the character an ASCII control character, e.g. `c < ' '`  ?
pub fip fun is-controlstd/core/is-control: (c : char) -> bool( cc: char : charstd/core/types/char: V )   : boolstd/core/types/bool: V
  cc: char <std/core/char/(<): (char, char) -> bool ' '

// Tests if a character is an element of `" \t\n\r"`
pub fip fun is-whitestd/core/is-white: (c : char) -> bool( cc: char : charstd/core/types/char: V )     : boolstd/core/types/bool: V
  cc: char ==std/core/char/(==): (char, char) -> bool ' ' ||std/core/types/(||): (x : bool, y : bool) -> bool cc: char ==std/core/char/(==): (char, char) -> bool '\t' ||std/core/types/(||): (x : bool, y : bool) -> bool cc: char ==std/core/char/(==): (char, char) -> bool '\n' ||std/core/types/(||): (x : bool, y : bool) -> bool cc: char ==std/core/char/(==): (char, char) -> bool '\r'

// ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
// Booleans
// ----------------------------------------------------------------------------

pub fip fun bool/(==)std/core/bool/(==): (x : bool, y : bool) -> bool( xx: bool : boolstd/core/types/bool: V, yy: bool : boolstd/core/types/bool: V) : boolstd/core/types/bool: V
  if xx: bool then yy: bool else !std/core/types/bool/(!): (b : bool) -> boolyy: bool

pub fip fun bool/(!=)std/core/bool/(!=): (x : bool, y : bool) -> bool( xx: bool : boolstd/core/types/bool: V, yy: bool : boolstd/core/types/bool: V) : boolstd/core/types/bool: V
  if xx: bool then !std/core/types/bool/(!): (b : bool) -> boolyy: bool else yy: bool

pub fip fun bool/(<)std/core/bool/(<): (x : bool, y : bool) -> bool( xx: bool : boolstd/core/types/bool: V, yy: bool : boolstd/core/types/bool: V) : boolstd/core/types/bool: V
  (!std/core/types/bool/(!): (b : bool) -> boolxx: bool &&std/core/types/(&&): (x : bool, y : bool) -> bool yy: bool)

pub fip fun bool/(<=)std/core/bool/(<=): (x : bool, y : bool) -> bool( xx: bool : boolstd/core/types/bool: V, yy: bool : boolstd/core/types/bool: V) : boolstd/core/types/bool: V
  !std/core/types/bool/(!): (b : bool) -> bool(xx: bool >std/core/bool/(>): (x : bool, y : bool) -> bool yy: bool)

pub fip fun bool/(>)std/core/bool/(>): (x : bool, y : bool) -> bool( xx: bool : boolstd/core/types/bool: V, yy: bool : boolstd/core/types/bool: V) : boolstd/core/types/bool: V
  (xx: bool &&std/core/types/(&&): (x : bool, y : bool) -> bool !std/core/types/bool/(!): (b : bool) -> boolyy: bool)

pub fip fun bool/(>=)std/core/bool/(>=): (x : bool, y : bool) -> bool( xx: bool : boolstd/core/types/bool: V, yy: bool : boolstd/core/types/bool: V) : boolstd/core/types/bool: V
  !std/core/types/bool/(!): (b : bool) -> bool(xx: bool <std/core/bool/(<): (x : bool, y : bool) -> bool yy: bool)

pub fip fun bool/cmpstd/core/bool/cmp: (x : bool, y : bool) -> order( xx: bool : boolstd/core/types/bool: V, yy: bool : boolstd/core/types/bool: V) : orderstd/core/types/order: V
  if xx: bool <std/core/bool/(<): (x : bool, y : bool) -> bool yy: bool then Ltstd/core/types/Lt: order
  elif xx: bool >std/core/bool/(>): (x : bool, y : bool) -> bool yy: bool then Gtstd/core/types/Gt: order
  else Eqstd/core/types/Eq: order

// Transform a boolean to a maybe type, using `Nothing` for `False`
pub fun bool/maybestd/core/bool/maybe: (b : bool) -> maybe<()>( bb: bool : boolstd/core/types/bool: V ) : maybestd/core/types/maybe: V -> V<(std/core/types/unit: V)std/core/types/unit: V>
  if bb: bool then Juststd/core/types/Just: forall<a> (value : a) -> maybe<a>((std/core/types/Unit: ())std/core/types/Unit: ()) else Nothingstd/core/types/Nothing: forall<a> maybe<a>


// ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
// Integers
// ----------------------------------------------------------------------------

// Compare two integers
pub inline fip extern int/cmpstd/core/int/cmp: (x : int, y : int) -> order(^x : intstd/core/types/int: V, ^y : intstd/core/types/int: V) : orderstd/core/types/order: V
  c inline "kk_int_as_order(kk_integer_cmp_borrow(#1,#2,kk_context()),kk_context())"
  cs "Primitive.IntCompare"
  js "$std_core._int_compare"

// Are two integers equal?
pub inline fip extern int/(==)std/core/int/(==): (x : int, y : int) -> bool(^x : intstd/core/types/int: V, ^y : intstd/core/types/int: V) : boolstd/core/types/bool: V
  c  "kk_integer_eq_borrow"
  cs inline "(#1 == #2)"
  js "$std_core._int_eq"

// Are two integers not equal?
pub inline fip extern int/(!=)std/core/int/(!=): (x : int, y : int) -> bool(^x : intstd/core/types/int: V, ^y : intstd/core/types/int: V) : boolstd/core/types/bool: V
  c  "kk_integer_neq_borrow"
  cs inline "(#1 != #2)"
  js "$std_core._int_ne"

// Is the first integer smaller or equal to the second?
pub inline fip extern int/(<=)std/core/int/(<=): (x : int, y : int) -> bool(^x : intstd/core/types/int: V, ^y : intstd/core/types/int: V) : boolstd/core/types/bool: V
  c  "kk_integer_lte_borrow"
  cs inline "(#1 <= #2)"
  js "$std_core._int_le"

// Is the first integer greater or equal to the second?
pub inline fip extern int/(>=)std/core/int/(>=): (x : int, y : int) -> bool(^x : intstd/core/types/int: V, ^y : intstd/core/types/int: V) : boolstd/core/types/bool: V
  c  "kk_integer_gte_borrow"
  cs inline "(#1 >= #2)"
  js "$std_core._int_ge"

// Is the first integer smaller than the second?
pub inline fip extern int/(<)std/core/int/(<): (x : int, y : int) -> bool(^x : intstd/core/types/int: V, ^y : intstd/core/types/int: V) : boolstd/core/types/bool: V
  c  "kk_integer_lt_borrow"
  cs inline "(#1 < #2)"
  js "$std_core._int_lt"

// Is the first integer greater than the second?
pub inline fip extern int/(>)std/core/int/(>): (x : int, y : int) -> bool(^x : intstd/core/types/int: V, ^y : intstd/core/types/int: V) : boolstd/core/types/bool: V
  c  "kk_integer_gt_borrow"
  cs inline "(#1 > #2)"
  js "$std_core._int_gt"

inline fip extern int-addstd/core/int-add: (int, int) -> int : (intstd/core/types/int: V,intstd/core/types/int: V) -> intstd/core/types/int: V
  c  "kk_integer_add"
  cs inline "(#1 + #2)"
  js "$std_core._int_add"

// Add two integers.
pub fip fun int/(+)std/core/int/(+): (x : int, y : int) -> int(xx: int : intstd/core/types/int: V, yy: int : intstd/core/types/int: V ) : intstd/core/types/int: V
  int-addstd/core/int-add: (int, int) -> int(xx: int,yy: int)

inline fip extern int/int-substd/core/int/int-sub: (int, int) -> int : (intstd/core/types/int: V,intstd/core/types/int: V) -> intstd/core/types/int: V

  cs inline "(#1 - #2)"
  js "$std_core._int_sub"

// Substract two integers.
pub fip fun int/(-)std/core/int/(-): (x : int, y : int) -> int(xx: int : intstd/core/types/int: V, yy: int : intstd/core/types/int: V ) : intstd/core/types/int: V
  int-substd/core/int/int-sub: (int, int) -> int(xx: int,yy: int)

// Multiply two integers.
pub inline fip extern int/(*)std/core/int/(*): (int, int) -> int : (intstd/core/types/int: V,intstd/core/types/int: V) -> intstd/core/types/int: V
  c  "kk_integer_mul"
  cs inline "(#1 * #2)"
  js "$std_core._int_mul"

// Euclidean-0 division of two integers. See also `divmod:(x : int, y : int) -> (int,int)`.
pub inline fip extern int/(/)std/core/int/(/): (x : int, y : int) -> int(x:intstd/core/types/int: V,y:intstd/core/types/int: V) : intstd/core/types/int: V
  c  "kk_integer_div"
  cs "Primitive.IntDiv"
  js "$std_core._int_div"

// Euclidean modulus of two integers; always a non-negative number. See also `divmod:(x : int, y : int) -> (int,int)`.
pub inline fip extern int/(%)std/core/int/(%): (int, int) -> int  : (intstd/core/types/int: V,intstd/core/types/int: V) -> intstd/core/types/int: V
  c  "kk_integer_mod"
  cs "Primitive.IntMod"
  js "$std_core._int_mod"

// Euclidean-0 division & modulus.
// Euclidean division is defined as: For any `D`  and `d`  where `d!=0` , we have:
//
// 1. `D == d*(D/d) + (D%d)`
// 2. `D%d`  is always positive where `0 <= D%d < abs(d)`
//
// Moreover, Euclidean-0 is a total function, for the case where `d==0`  we have
// that `D%0 == D`  and `D/0 == 0` . So property (1) still holds, but not property (2).
//
// Useful laws that hold for Euclidean-0 division:
//
// * `D/(-d) == -(D/d)`
// * `D%(-d) == D%d`
// * `D/(2^n) == sar(D,n)         `  (with `0 <= n <= 31`  and `2^n`  means `2`  to the power of `n` )
// * `D%(2^n) == D & ((2^n) - 1)  `  (with `0 <= n <= 31`  and `2^n`  means `2`  to the power of `n` )
//
// See also _Division and modulus for computer scientists, Daan Leijen, 2001_ for further information
// available at: <http://research.microsoft.com/pubs/151917/divmodnote.pdf> .
pub inline fip extern int/divmodstd/core/int/divmod: (x : int, y : int) -> (int, int)(x:intstd/core/types/int: V,y:intstd/core/types/int: V) : (std/core/types/tuple2: (V, V) -> Vintstd/core/types/int: V,intstd/core/types/int: V)
  c  "kk_integer_div_mod_tuple"
  cs "Primitive.IntDivMod"
  js "$std_core._int_divmod"

pub fip fun int/negatestd/core/int/negate: (i : int) -> int(ii: int : intstd/core/types/int: V) : intstd/core/types/int: V
  ~std/core/int/(~): (i : int) -> intii: int

// Negate an integer.
pub inline fip extern int/(~)std/core/int/(~): (i : int) -> int(i:intstd/core/types/int: V) : intstd/core/types/int: V
  c  "kk_integer_neg"
  cs inline "(-#1)"
  js "$std_core._int_negate"

// Convert an integer to a `:float64`. May return `nan` if the integer is too large to represent as a `:float64`.
pub inline fip extern int/float64std/core/int/float64: (i : int) -> float64( i : intstd/core/types/int: V) : float64std/core/types/float64: V
  c  "kk_integer_as_double"
  cs "Primitive.IntToDouble"
  js "$std_core._int_to_double"

// Convert an integer to a `:float32`. May return `nan` if the integer is too large to represent as a `:float32`.
pub inline fip extern int/float32std/core/int/float32: (i : int) -> float32( i : intstd/core/types/int: V) : float32std/core/types/float32: V
  c  "kk_integer_as_float"
  cs "Primitive.IntToFloat"
  js "$std_core._int_to_float"

// Is this an odd integer?
pub inline fip extern int/is-oddstd/core/int/is-odd: (i : int) -> bool( i : intstd/core/types/int: V ) : boolstd/core/types/bool: V
  c  "kk_integer_is_odd"
  cs inline "!(#1.IsEven)"
  js "$std_core._int_isodd"

// Is this equal to zero?

  c  inline "kk_integer_is_zero_borrow(#1)"
  cs inline "(#1.IsZero)"
  js "$std_core._int_iszero"

  js "$std_core._int_abs"

// Increment
pub fip fun int/incstd/core/int/inc: (i : int) -> int( ii: int : intstd/core/types/int: V ) : intstd/core/types/int: V
  ii: int +std/core/int/(+): (x : int, y : int) -> int 1

// Decrement
pub fip fun int/decstd/core/int/dec: (i : int) -> int( ii: int : intstd/core/types/int: V ) : intstd/core/types/int: V

// Calculate `10^exp`
pub fip fun exp10std/core/exp10: (exp : int) -> int( expexp: int : intstd/core/types/int: V ) : intstd/core/types/int: V
  1.mul-exp10std/core/mul-exp10: (i : int, n : int) -> int(expexp: int)

// Raise an integer `i` to the power of `exp`.
pub fip extern powstd/core/pow: (i : int, exp : int) -> int( ii: int : intstd/core/types/int: V, expexp: int : intstd/core/types/int: V ) : intstd/core/types/int: V
  c  "kk_integer_pow"
  cs "Primitive.IntPow"
  js "_int_pow"

// Raise an integer `i` to the power of `exp`.
pub fip fun (^)std/core/(^): (i : int, exp : int) -> int(ii: int : intstd/core/types/int: V, expexp: int : intstd/core/types/int: V ) : intstd/core/types/int: V
  powstd/core/pow: (i : int, exp : int) -> int(ii: int,expexp: int)

// Calculate `2^exp`.
pub fip fun exp2std/core/exp2: (exp : int) -> int( expexp: int : intstd/core/types/int: V ) : intstd/core/types/int: V
  powstd/core/pow: (i : int, exp : int) -> int(2,expexp: int)

// Return the number of ending `0` digits of `i`. Return `0` when `i==0`.
pub fip extern is-exp10std/core/is-exp10: (i : int) -> int( ii: int : intstd/core/types/int: V ) : intstd/core/types/int: V
  c  "kk_integer_ctz"
  cs "Primitive.IntCountPow10"
  js "_int_count_pow10"

// Return the number of decimal digits of `i`. Return `0` when `i==0`.
