  c  "kk_integer_count_digits"
  cs "Primitive.IntCountDigits"
  js "_int_count_digits"

pub fip extern mul-exp10std/core/mul-exp10: (i : int, n : int) -> int( ii: int : intstd/core/types/int: V, nn: int : intstd/core/types/int: V ) : intstd/core/types/int: V
  c  "kk_integer_mul_pow10"
  cs "Primitive.IntMulPow10"
  js "_int_mul_pow10"

pub fip extern cdiv-exp10std/core/cdiv-exp10: (i : int, n : int) -> int( ii: int : intstd/core/types/int: V, nn: int : intstd/core/types/int: V ) : intstd/core/types/int: V
  c  "kk_integer_cdiv_pow10"
  cs "Primitive.IntCDivPow10"
  js "_int_cdiv_pow10"

pub fun cdivmod-exp10std/core/cdivmod-exp10: (i : int, n : int) -> (int, int)( ii: int : intstd/core/types/int: V, nn: int : intstd/core/types/int: V ) : (std/core/types/tuple2: (V, V) -> Vintstd/core/types/int: V,intstd/core/types/int: V)
  if nn: int <=std/core/int/(<=): (x : int, y : int) -> bool 0 returnreturn: (int, int) (std/core/types/Tuple2: forall<a,b> (fst : a, snd : b) -> (a, b)ii: int,0)std/core/types/Tuple2: forall<a,b> (fst : a, snd : b) -> (a, b)
  val cqcq: int = ii: int.cdiv-exp10std/core/cdiv-exp10: (i : int, n : int) -> int(nn: int)
  val crcr: int = ii: int -std/core/int/(-): (x : int, y : int) -> int cqcq: int.mul-exp10std/core/mul-exp10: (i : int, n : int) -> int(nn: int)
  (std/core/types/Tuple2: forall<a,b> (fst : a, snd : b) -> (a, b)cqcq: int,crcr: int)std/core/types/Tuple2: forall<a,b> (fst : a, snd : b) -> (a, b)

pub fun divmod-exp10std/core/divmod-exp10: (i : int, n : int) -> (int, int)( ii: int : intstd/core/types/int: V, nn: int : intstd/core/types/int: V ) : (std/core/types/tuple2: (V, V) -> Vintstd/core/types/int: V,intstd/core/types/int: V)
  val (std/core/types/Tuple2: forall<a,b> (fst : a, snd : b) -> (a, b)cqcq: int,crcr: int)std/core/types/Tuple2: forall<a,b> (fst : a, snd : b) -> (a, b) = cdivmod-exp10std/core/cdivmod-exp10: (i : int, n : int) -> (int, int)(ii: int,nn: int)
  if !std/core/types/bool/(!): (b : bool) -> boolcrcr: int.is-negstd/core/is-neg: (i : int) -> bool then (std/core/types/Tuple2: forall<a,b> (fst : a, snd : b) -> (a, b)cqcq: int,crcr: int)std/core/types/Tuple2: forall<a,b> (fst : a, snd : b) -> (a, b) else (std/core/types/Tuple2: forall<a,b> (fst : a, snd : b) -> (a, b)cqcq: int.decstd/core/int/dec: (i : int) -> int, crcr: int +std/core/int/(+): (x : int, y : int) -> int exp10std/core/exp10: (exp : int) -> int(nn: int))std/core/types/Tuple2: forall<a,b> (fst : a, snd : b) -> (a, b)

// Is this an even integer?
pub fip fun is-evenstd/core/is-even: (i : int) -> bool(ii: int:intstd/core/types/int: V) : boolstd/core/types/bool: V
  !std/core/types/bool/(!): (b : bool) -> boolis-oddstd/core/int/is-odd: (i : int) -> bool(ii: int)

// Is the integer positive (stricly greater than zero)
pub fip fun is-posstd/core/is-pos: (i : int) -> bool(ii: int : intstd/core/types/int: V ) : boolstd/core/types/bool: V
  ii: int >std/core/int/(>): (x : int, y : int) -> bool 0

// Is the integer negative (stricly smaller than zero)
pub fip fun is-negstd/core/is-neg: (i : int) -> bool(ii: int : intstd/core/types/int: V ) : boolstd/core/types/bool: V
  ii: int <std/core/int/(<): (x : int, y : int) -> bool 0

// Compare an integer `i` with zero
pub inline fip extern signstd/core/sign: (i : int) -> order( ^i : intstd/core/types/int: V ) : orderstd/core/types/order: V
  c  inline "kk_int_as_order(kk_integer_signum_borrow(#1,kk_context()),kk_context())"
  cs "Primitive.IntSign"
  js "$std_core._int_sign"

// Return the minimum of two integers
pub fip fun minstd/core/min: (i : int, j : int) -> int( ii: int : intstd/core/types/int: V, jj: int : intstd/core/types/int: V ) : intstd/core/types/int: V
  if ii: int <=std/core/int/(<=): (x : int, y : int) -> bool jj: int then ii: int else jj: int

// Return the maximum of two integers
pub fip fun maxstd/core/max: (i : int, j : int) -> int( ii: int : intstd/core/types/int: V, jj: int : intstd/core/types/int: V ) : intstd/core/types/int: V
  if ii: int >=std/core/int/(>=): (x : int, y : int) -> bool jj: int then ii: int else jj: int

// Returns the smallest element of a list of integers (or `default` (=`0`) for the empty list)
pub fun minimumstd/core/minimum: (xs : list<int>, default : ? int) -> int( xsxs: list<int> : liststd/core/list: V -> V<intstd/core/types/int: V>, defaultdefault: ? int : intstd/core/types/optional: V -> V = 0 ) : intstd/core/types/int: V
  match xsxs: list<int>
    Nilstd/core/Nil: forall<a> list<a> -> defaultdefault: int
    Consstd/core/Cons: forall<a> (head : a, tail : list<a>) -> list<a>(xx: int,xxxx: list<int>) -> xxxx: list<int>.foldlstd/core/foldl: (xs : list<int>, z : int, f : (int, int) -> int) -> int( xx: int, minstd/core/min: (i : int, j : int) -> int )

// Returns the largest element of a list of integers (or `default` (=`0`) for the empty list)
pub fun maximumstd/core/maximum: (xs : list<int>, default : ? int) -> int( xsxs: list<int> : liststd/core/list: V -> V<intstd/core/types/int: V>, defaultdefault: ? int : intstd/core/types/optional: V -> V = 0 ) : intstd/core/types/int: V
  match xsxs: list<int>
    Nilstd/core/Nil: forall<a> list<a> -> defaultdefault: int
    Consstd/core/Cons: forall<a> (head : a, tail : list<a>) -> list<a>(xx: int,xxxx: list<int>) -> xxxx: list<int>.foldlstd/core/foldl: (xs : list<int>, z : int, f : (int, int) -> int) -> int( xx: int, maxstd/core/max: (i : int, j : int) -> int )

// Return the sum of a list of integers
pub fun sumstd/core/sum: (xs : list<int>) -> int( xsxs: list<int> : liststd/core/list: V -> V<intstd/core/types/int: V> ) : intstd/core/types/int: V
  xsxs: list<int>.foldlstd/core/foldl: (xs : list<int>, z : int, f : (int, int) -> int) -> int( 0, fnfn: (x : int, y : int) -> int(xx: int,yy: int) { xx: int +std/core/int/(+): (x : int, y : int) -> int yy: int } )

// Transform an integer to a maybe type, using `Nothing` for `0`
pub fun maybestd/core/maybe: (i : int) -> maybe<int>( ii: int : intstd/core/types/int: V ) : maybestd/core/types/maybe: V -> V<intstd/core/types/int: V>
  if ii: int==std/core/int/(==): (x : int, y : int) -> bool0 then Nothingstd/core/types/Nothing: forall<a> maybe<a> else Juststd/core/types/Just: forall<a> (value : a) -> maybe<a>(ii: int)

// Fold over the integers between [`start`,`end`] (inclusive).
pub fun int/foldstd/core/int/fold: forall<a,e> (start : int, end : int, init : a, f : (int, a) -> e a) -> e a( startstart: int : intstd/core/types/int: V, endend: int : intstd/core/types/int: V, initinit: $16214 : aa: V, ff: (int, $16214) -> $16215 $16214 : (intstd/core/types/int: V,aa: V) -> ee: E aa: V ) : ee: E aa: V
  if startstart: int >=std/core/int/(>=): (x : int, y : int) -> $16215 bool endend: int then initinit: $16214 else
    val xx: $16214 = ff: (int, $16214) -> $16215 $16214(startstart: int,initinit: $16214)
    foldstd/core/int/fold: (start : int, end : int, init : $16214, f : (int, $16214) -> $16215 $16214) -> $16215 $16214(unsafe-decreasingstd/core/types/unsafe-decreasing: (x : int) -> $16215 int(startstart: int.incstd/core/int/inc: (i : int) -> $16215 int), endend: int, xx: $16214, ff: (int, $16214) -> $16215 $16214)

// Fold over the integers between [0,`upto`)  (not including `upto`).
pub fun int/fold-uptostd/core/int/fold-upto: forall<a,e> (upto : int, init : a, f : (int, a) -> e a) -> e a( uptoupto: int : intstd/core/types/int: V, initinit: $16271 : aa: V, ff: (int, $16271) -> $16272 $16271 : (intstd/core/types/int: V,aa: V) -> ee: E aa: V ) : ee: E aa: V
  foldstd/core/int/fold: (start : int, end : int, init : $16271, f : (int, $16271) -> $16272 $16271) -> $16272 $16271( 0, uptoupto: int.decstd/core/int/dec: (i : int) -> $16272 int, initinit: $16271, ff: (int, $16271) -> $16272 $16271 )

// Fold over the integes between [`start``,`end`] (inclusive) or until `f` returns `Nothing`
pub fun int/fold-whilestd/core/int/fold-while: forall<a,e> (start : int, end : int, init : a, f : (int, a) -> e maybe<a>) -> e a( startstart: int : intstd/core/types/int: V, endend: int : intstd/core/types/int: V, initinit: $16300 : aa: V, ff: (int, $16300) -> $16301 maybe<$16300> : (intstd/core/types/int: V,aa: V) -> ee: E maybestd/core/types/maybe: V -> V<aa: V> ) : ee: E aa: V
  if startstart: int >=std/core/int/(>=): (x : int, y : int) -> $16301 bool endend: int then initinit: $16300 else
    match ff: (int, $16300) -> $16301 maybe<$16300>(startstart: int,initinit: $16300)
      Juststd/core/types/Just: forall<a> (value : a) -> maybe<a>(xx: $16300) -> fold-whilestd/core/int/fold-while: (start : int, end : int, init : $16300, f : (int, $16300) -> $16301 maybe<$16300>) -> $16301 $16300(unsafe-decreasingstd/core/types/unsafe-decreasing: (x : int) -> $16301 int(startstart: int.incstd/core/int/inc: (i : int) -> $16301 int), endend: int, xx: $16300, ff: (int, $16300) -> $16301 maybe<$16300>)
      Nothingstd/core/types/Nothing: forall<a> maybe<a> -> initinit: $16300

// ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
// 32-bit integers
// Just define the operations needed for defining the std/core interface but
// don't export any definitions here. Full operations are defined in `std/int32`.
// ----------------------------------------------------------------------------

// Convert an `:int32` to an `:int`.
pub inline fip extern int32/intstd/core/int32/int: (i : int32) -> int( i : int32std/core/types/int32: V ) : intstd/core/types/int: V
  c  "kk_integer_from_int"
  cs inline "(new BigInteger(#1))"
  js "$std_core._int_from_int32"

// Convert an integer to an `:int32`. The number is _clamped_ to the maximal or minimum `:int32`
// value if it is outside the range of an `:int32`.
pub inline fip extern int32std/core/int32: (i : int) -> int32( i : intstd/core/types/int: V) : int32std/core/types/int32: V
  c  "kk_integer_clamp32"
  cs "Primitive.IntToInt32"
  js "$std_core._int_clamp32"

// Convenient shorthand to `int32`, e.g. `1234.i32`
pub inline fip fun i32std/core/i32: (i : int) -> int32( ii: int : intstd/core/types/int: V ) : int32std/core/types/int32: V
  ii: int.int32std/core/int32: (i : int) -> int32


// Minimal set of operations that we need in `std/core`.
inline fip extern int32/(<=)std/core/int32/(<=): (int32, int32) -> bool : (int32std/core/types/int32: V,int32std/core/types/int32: V) -> boolstd/core/types/bool: V
  inline "(#1 <= #2)"
  js inline "(#1 <= #2)"

inline fip extern int32/(<)std/core/int32/(<): (int32, int32) -> bool  : (int32std/core/types/int32: V,int32std/core/types/int32: V) -> boolstd/core/types/bool: V
  inline "(#1 < #2)"
  js inline "(#1 < #2)"

inline fip extern int32/(+)std/core/int32/(+): (int32, int32) -> int32  : (int32std/core/types/int32: V,int32std/core/types/int32: V) -> int32std/core/types/int32: V
  inline "(#1 + #2)"
  js inline "((#1 + #2)|0)"

inline fip extern int32/(-)std/core/int32/(-): (int32, int32) -> int32  : (int32std/core/types/int32: V,int32std/core/types/int32: V) -> int32std/core/types/int32: V
  inline "(#1 - #2)"
  js inline "((#1 - #2)|0)"

inline fip extern int32/is-posstd/core/int32/is-pos: (i : int32) -> bool( i : int32std/core/types/int32: V ) : boolstd/core/types/bool: V
  inline "(#1>0)"

inline fip extern int32/is-negstd/core/int32/is-neg: (i : int32) -> bool( i : int32std/core/types/int32: V ) : boolstd/core/types/bool: V
  inline "(#1<0)"


fip fun int32/incrstd/core/int32/incr: (i : int32) -> int32( ii: int32 : int32std/core/types/int32: V ) : int32std/core/types/int32: V
  ii: int32 +std/core/int32/(+): (int32, int32) -> int32 1.int32std/core/int32: (i : int) -> int32

fip fun int32/decrstd/core/int32/decr: (i : int32) -> int32( ii: int32 : int32std/core/types/int32: V ) : int32std/core/types/int32: V
  ii: int32 -std/core/int32/(-): (int32, int32) -> int32 1.int32std/core/int32: (i : int) -> int32

// ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
// N-bit ssize_t
// Just define the operations needed for defining the std/core interface but
// don't export any definitions here.
// ----------------------------------------------------------------------------

// Convert an integer to an `:ssize_t`. The number is _clamped_ to the maximal or minimum `:ssize_t`
// value if it is outside the range of an `:ssize_t`.
pub fip extern ssize_tstd/core/ssize_t: (i : int) -> ssize_t( ii: int : intstd/core/types/int: V) : ssize_tstd/core/types/ssize_t: V
  c  "kk_integer_clamp_ssize_t"
  cs "Primitive.IntToInt32"
  js "$std_core._int_clamp32"

// Convert an `:ssize_t` to an `:int`.
pub inline fip extern ssize_t/intstd/core/ssize_t/int: (i : ssize_t) -> int( i : ssize_tstd/core/types/ssize_t: V ) : intstd/core/types/int: V
  c  "kk_integer_from_ssize_t"
  cs inline "(new BigInteger(#1))"
  js "$std_core._int_from_int32"

// Minimal set of operations that we need in `std/core`.
inline fip extern ssize_t/(<=)std/core/ssize_t/(<=): (ssize_t, ssize_t) -> bool : (ssize_tstd/core/types/ssize_t: V,ssize_tstd/core/types/ssize_t: V) -> boolstd/core/types/bool: V
  inline "(#1 <= #2)"

inline fip extern ssize_t/(>=)std/core/ssize_t/(>=): (ssize_t, ssize_t) -> bool : (ssize_tstd/core/types/ssize_t: V,ssize_tstd/core/types/ssize_t: V) -> boolstd/core/types/bool: V
  inline "(#1 >= #2)"

inline fip extern ssize_t/(<)std/core/ssize_t/(<): (ssize_t, ssize_t) -> bool  : (ssize_tstd/core/types/ssize_t: V,ssize_tstd/core/types/ssize_t: V) -> boolstd/core/types/bool: V
  inline "(#1 < #2)"

inline fip extern ssize_t/(+)std/core/ssize_t/(+): (ssize_t, ssize_t) -> ssize_t  : (ssize_tstd/core/types/ssize_t: V,ssize_tstd/core/types/ssize_t: V) -> ssize_tstd/core/types/ssize_t: V
  inline "(#1 + #2)"
  js inline "((#1 + #2)|0)"

inline fip extern ssize_t/(-)std/core/ssize_t/(-): (ssize_t, ssize_t) -> ssize_t  : (ssize_tstd/core/types/ssize_t: V,ssize_tstd/core/types/ssize_t: V) -> ssize_tstd/core/types/ssize_t: V
  inline "(#1 - #2)"
  js inline "((#1 - #2)|0)"

inline fip extern ssize_t/is-posstd/core/ssize_t/is-pos: (i : ssize_t) -> bool( i : ssize_tstd/core/types/ssize_t: V ) : boolstd/core/types/bool: V
  inline "(#1 > 0)"

inline fip extern ssize_t/is-negstd/core/ssize_t/is-neg: (i : ssize_t) -> bool( i : ssize_tstd/core/types/ssize_t: V ) : boolstd/core/types/bool: V
  inline "(#1 < 0)"

fip extern ssize_t/is-zerostd/core/ssize_t/is-zero: (i : ssize_t) -> bool( ii: ssize_t : ssize_tstd/core/types/ssize_t: V ) : boolstd/core/types/bool: V
  inline "(#1 == 0)"
  js inline "(#1 === 0)"

fip extern ssize_t/decrstd/core/ssize_t/decr: (i : ssize_t) -> ssize_t(ii: ssize_t : ssize_tstd/core/types/ssize_t: V ) : ssize_tstd/core/types/ssize_t: V
  inline "(#1 - 1)"

fip extern ssize_t/incrstd/core/ssize_t/incr: (i : ssize_t) -> ssize_t(ii: ssize_t : ssize_tstd/core/types/ssize_t: V ) : ssize_tstd/core/types/ssize_t: V
  inline "(#1 + 1)"


// ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
// int8
// ----------------------------------------------------------------------------

// clamp an `:int` to fit in an `:int8`.
pub fip extern int8std/core/int8: (i : int) -> int8( ii: int : intstd/core/types/int: V) : int8std/core/types/int8: V
  c  "kk_integer_clamp_int8"
  cs "Primitive.IntToInt8"
  js "$std_core._int_clamp8"

// Convert an `:int8` to an `:int`.
pub inline fip extern int8/intstd/core/int8/int: (i : int8) -> int( i : int8std/core/types/int8: V ) : intstd/core/types/int: V
  c  "kk_integer_from_int8"
  cs inline "(new BigInteger(#1))"
  js "$std_core._int_from_int32"


// clamp an `:int` to fit in an `:int8` but interpret the `:int` as an unsigned 8-bit value,
// and clamp between 0 and 255.
pub fip extern uint8std/core/uint8: (i : int) -> int8( ii: int : intstd/core/types/int: V) : int8std/core/types/int8: V
  c  "kk_integer_clamp_byte"
  cs "Primitive.IntToUInt8"
  js "$std_core._int_clamp_byte"

// Convert an `:int8` to an `:int` but interpret the `:int8` as an unsigned 8-bit value between 0 and 255.
pub inline fip extern int8/uintstd/core/int8/uint: (i : int8) -> int( i : int8std/core/types/int8: V ) : intstd/core/types/int: V
  c  "kk_integer_from_uint8"
  cs inline "(new BigInteger(#1 >= 0 ? #1 : 256 + #1))"
  js "$std_core._int_from_int32"


// ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
// int16
// ----------------------------------------------------------------------------

// clamp an `:int` to fit in an `:int16`.
pub fip extern int16std/core/int16: (i : int) -> int16( ii: int : intstd/core/types/int: V) : int16std/core/types/int16: V
  c  "kk_integer_clamp_int16"
  cs "Primitive.IntToInt16"
  js "$std_core._int_clamp16"

// Convert an `:int16` to an `:int`.
pub inline fip extern int16/intstd/core/int16/int: (i : int16) -> int( i : int16std/core/types/int16: V ) : intstd/core/types/int: V
  c  "kk_integer_from_int16"
  cs inline "(new BigInteger(#1))"
  js "$std_core._int_from_int32"


// ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
// int64
// ----------------------------------------------------------------------------

// clamp an `:int` to fit in an `:int64_t`.
pub fip extern int64std/core/int64: (i : int) -> int64( ii: int : intstd/core/types/int: V) : int64std/core/types/int64: V
  c  "kk_integer_clamp64"
  cs "Primitive.IntToInt64"
  js "$std_core._int_clamp64"

// Convert an `:int64_t` to an `:int`.
pub inline fip extern int64/intstd/core/int64/int: (i : int64) -> int( i : int64std/core/types/int64: V ) : intstd/core/types/int: V
  c  "kk_integer_from_int64"
  cs inline "(new BigInteger(#1))"
  js "$std_core._int_from_int64"

// Convenient shorthand to `int64`, e.g. `1234.i64`
pub inline fip fun i64std/core/i64: (i : int) -> int64( ii: int : intstd/core/types/int: V ) : int64std/core/types/int64: V
  ii: int.int64std/core/int64: (i : int) -> int64


// ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
// intptr_t
// ----------------------------------------------------------------------------

// clamp an `:int` to fit in an `:intptr_t`.
pub fip extern intptr_tstd/core/intptr_t: (i : int) -> intptr_t( ii: int : intstd/core/types/int: V) : intptr_tstd/core/types/intptr_t: V
  c  "kk_integer_clamp_intptr_t"
  cs "Primitive.IntToInt64"
  js "$std_core._int_clamp64"

// Convert an `:intptr_t` to an `:int`.
pub inline fip extern intptr_t/intstd/core/intptr_t/int: (i : intptr_t) -> int( i : intptr_tstd/core/types/intptr_t: V ) : intstd/core/types/int: V
  c  "kk_integer_from_intptr_t"
  cs inline "(new BigInteger(#1))"
  js "$std_core._int_from_int64"



// ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
// Parse numbers
// ----------------------------------------------------------------------------

// Parse an integer using `parseInt`. If an illegal digit character is encountered the
// `default` value is returned. An empty string will also result in `default`.
pub fun parse-int-defaultstd/core/parse-int-default: (s : string, default : ? int, hex : ? bool) -> int( ss: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V, defaultdefault: ? int : intstd/core/types/optional: V -> V = 0, hexhex: ? bool : boolstd/core/types/optional: V -> V = Falsestd/core/types/False: bool ) : intstd/core/types/int: V
  if ss: string.is-emptystd/core/string/is-empty: (s : string) -> bool then defaultdefault: int else ss: string.parse-intstd/core/parse-int: (s : string, hex : ? bool) -> maybe<int>(hexhex: bool).maybestd/core/default/maybe: (m : maybe<int>, nothing : int) -> int(defaultdefault: int)

// Parse an integer after trimming whitespace.
// If an illegal digit character is encountered `Nothing` is returned.
// An empty string will result in `Just(0)`.
// A string can start with a `-` sign for negative numbers,
// and with `0x` or `0X` for hexadecimal numbers (in which case the `hex` parameter is ignored).
pub fun parse-intstd/core/parse-int: (s : string, hex : ? bool) -> maybe<int>( ss: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V, hexhex: ? bool : boolstd/core/types/optional: V -> V = Falsestd/core/types/False: bool) : maybestd/core/types/maybe: V -> V<intstd/core/types/int: V>
  ss: string.trimstd/core/trim: (s : string) -> string.xparse-intstd/core/xparse-int: (s : string, hex : bool) -> maybe<int>(hexhex: bool)

extern xparse-intstd/core/xparse-int: (s : string, hex : bool) -> maybe<int>( ss: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V, hexhex: bool : boolstd/core/types/bool: V ) : maybestd/core/types/maybe: V -> V<intstd/core/types/int: V>
  c  "kk_integer_xparse"
  cs "Primitive.IntParse"
  js "_int_parse"

// ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
// Floating point
// todo: move to std/num/float64
// ----------------------------------------------------------------------------

pub inline fip extern float64/(==)std/core/float64/(==): (float64, float64) -> bool : (float64std/core/types/float64: V,float64std/core/types/float64: V) -> boolstd/core/types/bool: V  { inline "(#1 == #2)"; js inline "(#1 === #2)" }
pub inline fip extern float64/(!=)std/core/float64/(!=): (float64, float64) -> bool : (float64std/core/types/float64: V,float64std/core/types/float64: V) -> boolstd/core/types/bool: V  { inline "(#1 != #2)"; js inline "(#1 !== #2)" }
pub inline fip extern float64/(<=)std/core/float64/(<=): (float64, float64) -> bool : (float64std/core/types/float64: V,float64std/core/types/float64: V) -> boolstd/core/types/bool: V  { inline "(#1 <= #2)" }
pub inline fip extern float64/(>=)std/core/float64/(>=): (float64, float64) -> bool : (float64std/core/types/float64: V,float64std/core/types/float64: V) -> boolstd/core/types/bool: V  { inline "(#1 >= #2)" }
pub inline fip extern float64/(<)std/core/float64/(<): (float64, float64) -> bool  : (float64std/core/types/float64: V,float64std/core/types/float64: V) -> boolstd/core/types/bool: V  { inline "(#1 < #2)" }
pub inline fip extern float64/(>)std/core/float64/(>): (float64, float64) -> bool  : (float64std/core/types/float64: V,float64std/core/types/float64: V) -> boolstd/core/types/bool: V  { inline "(#1 > #2)" }
pub inline fip extern float64/(+)std/core/float64/(+): (float64, float64) -> float64 : (float64std/core/types/float64: V,float64std/core/types/float64: V) -> float64std/core/types/float64: V { inline "(#1 + #2)" }
pub inline fip extern float64/(-)std/core/float64/(-): (float64, float64) -> float64 : (float64std/core/types/float64: V,float64std/core/types/float64: V) -> float64std/core/types/float64: V { inline "(#1 - #2)" }
pub inline fip extern float64/(*)std/core/float64/(*): (float64, float64) -> float64 : (float64std/core/types/float64: V,float64std/core/types/float64: V) -> float64std/core/types/float64: V { inline "(#1 * #2)" }
pub inline fip extern float64/(/)std/core/float64/(/): (float64, float64) -> float64 : (float64std/core/types/float64: V,float64std/core/types/float64: V) -> float64std/core/types/float64: V { inline "(#1 / #2)" }
pub inline fip extern float64/(%)std/core/float64/(%): (float64, float64) -> float64 : (float64std/core/types/float64: V,float64std/core/types/float64: V) -> float64std/core/types/float64: V { c inline "fmod(#1,#2)"; inline "(#1 % #2)" }


// Is the value negative?
pub fip fun float64/is-negstd/core/float64/is-neg: (d : float64) -> bool( dd: float64 : float64std/core/types/float64: V ) : boolstd/core/types/bool: V
  dd: float64 <std/core/float64/(<): (float64, float64) -> bool 0.0

// Is the value positive?
pub fip fun float64/is-posstd/core/float64/is-pos: (d : float64) -> bool( dd: float64 : float64std/core/types/float64: V ) : boolstd/core/types/bool: V
  dd: float64 >std/core/float64/(>): (float64, float64) -> bool 0.0

// Is the value zero?
pub fip fun float64/is-zerostd/core/float64/is-zero: (d : float64) -> bool( dd: float64 : float64std/core/types/float64: V ) : boolstd/core/types/bool: V
  dd: float64 ==std/core/float64/(==): (float64, float64) -> bool 0.0

pub fip fun float64/signstd/core/float64/sign: (d : float64) -> order( dd: float64 : float64std/core/types/float64: V ) : orderstd/core/types/order: V
  if dd: float64 <std/core/float64/(<): (float64, float64) -> bool 0.0 then Ltstd/core/types/Lt: order elif dd: float64 >std/core/float64/(>): (float64, float64) -> bool 0.0 then Gtstd/core/types/Gt: order else Eqstd/core/types/Eq: order

// Negate a `:float64`.
pub inline fip extern float64/(~)std/core/float64/(~): (f : float64) -> float64( f : float64std/core/types/float64: V ) : float64std/core/types/float64: V
  inline "(-#1)"  // inline so `~0.0` becomes negative zero

// convert a `:float64` to an `:int` using `round` to round to its nearest integer.
// (rounding to an even number on a tie)
// Returns `0` if the argument is not `finite?`.
pub inline extern float64/intstd/core/float64/int: (f : float64) -> int( f : float64std/core/types/float64: V ) : intstd/core/types/int: V
  c  "kk_integer_from_double"
  cs "Primitive.IntDouble"
  js "$std_core._int_double"

// Returns the value `f`  raised to the power `p` .
pub inline fip extern float64/(^)std/core/float64/(^): (f : float64, p : float64) -> float64( f : float64std/core/types/float64: V, p : float64std/core/types/float64: V) : float64std/core/types/float64: V
  c inline "pow(#1,#2)"
  cs "Math.Pow"
  js "Math.pow"

// Return the absolute value of a `:float64` `f`
pub inline fip extern float64/absstd/core/float64/abs: (f : float64) -> float64( f : float64std/core/types/float64: V ) : float64std/core/types/float64: V
  c inline "kk_double_abs(#1)"
  cs "Math.Abs"
  js "Math.abs"

// Returns the smallest of two floats
pub fip fun float64/minstd/core/float64/min: (x : float64, y : float64) -> float64( xx: float64 : float64std/core/types/float64: V, yy: float64 : float64std/core/types/float64: V ) : float64std/core/types/float64: V
  if xx: float64 <=std/core/float64/(<=): (float64, float64) -> bool yy: float64 then xx: float64 else yy: float64

// Returns the largest of two floats
pub fip fun float64/maxstd/core/float64/max: (x : float64, y : float64) -> float64( xx: float64 : float64std/core/types/float64: V, yy: float64 : float64std/core/types/float64: V ) : float64std/core/types/float64: V
  if xx: float64 >=std/core/float64/(>=): (float64, float64) -> bool yy: float64 then xx: float64 else yy: float64

// Returns the smallest element of a list of floats (or `0` for the empty list)
pub fun float64/minimumstd/core/float64/minimum: (xs : list<float64>) -> float64( xsxs: list<float64> : liststd/core/list: V -> V<float64std/core/types/float64: V> ) : float64std/core/types/float64: V
  match xsxs: list<float64>
    Nilstd/core/Nil: forall<a> list<a> -> 0.0
    Consstd/core/Cons: forall<a> (head : a, tail : list<a>) -> list<a>(xx: float64,xxxx: list<float64>) -> xxxx: list<float64>.foldlstd/core/foldl: (xs : list<float64>, z : float64, f : (float64, float64) -> float64) -> float64( xx: float64, minstd/core/float64/min: (x : float64, y : float64) -> float64 )

// Returns the largest element of a list of floats (or `0` for the empty list)
pub fun float64/maximumstd/core/float64/maximum: (xs : list<float64>) -> float64( xsxs: list<float64> : liststd/core/list: V -> V<float64std/core/types/float64: V> ) : float64std/core/types/float64: V
  match xsxs: list<float64>
    Nilstd/core/Nil: forall<a> list<a> -> 0.0
    Consstd/core/Cons: forall<a> (head : a, tail : list<a>) -> list<a>(xx: float64,xxxx: list<float64>) -> xxxx: list<float64>.foldlstd/core/foldl: (xs : list<float64>, z : float64, f : (float64, float64) -> float64) -> float64( xx: float64, maxstd/core/float64/max: (x : float64, y : float64) -> float64 )

// ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
// Strings
// ----------------------------------------------------------------------------

// A `:sslice` represents a sub-slice of string and
// has a specific start position and character count. It is used
// instead of string indices to make the actual internal representation
// of strings abstract (like UTF-8 or UTF-16). String slices are
// returned by functions that find sub strings or patterns in
// in strings. Use `string:(slice : sslice) -> string` to
// create a fresh substring from a slice.
//
// The start and len fields of a slice are in terms of bytes.
// Slices should only be interacted with safe methods defined in core
// that take care to not cut strings in the middle of a utf codepoint.
abstract value struct sslicestd/core/sslice: V( strstd/core/sslice/str: (sslice : sslice) -> string : stringstd/core/types/string: V, startstd/core/sslice/start: (sslice : sslice) -> int : intstd/core/types/int: V, lenstd/core/sslice/len: (sslice : sslice) -> int : intstd/core/types/int: V )

// Internal export for the regex module
pub fun "@new-sslice"( strstr: string :stringstd/core/types/string: V, startstart: int: intstd/core/types/int: V, lenlen: int : intstd/core/types/int: V )
  Sslicestd/core/Sslice: (str : string, start : int, len : int) -> sslice(strstr: string,startstart: int,lenlen: int)

// Convert a character to a string
pub extern char/stringstd/core/char/string: (c : char) -> string : ( c : charstd/core/types/char: V ) -> stringstd/core/types/string: V
  c  "kk_string_from_char"
  cs inline "Primitive.CharToString(#1)"
  js inline "_char_to_string(#1)"

// Convert a vector of characters to a string.
pub extern vector/stringstd/core/vector/string: (vector<char>) -> string : (vectorstd/core/types/vector: V -> V<charstd/core/types/char: V>) -> stringstd/core/types/string: V
  c  "kk_string_from_chars"
  cs inline "Primitive.CharsToString(#1)"
  js inline "_chars_to_string(#1)"

// Convert a string to a vector of characters.
pub extern string/vectorstd/core/string/vector: (s : string) -> vector<char> : ( s : stringstd/core/types/string: V ) -> vectorstd/core/types/vector: V -> V<charstd/core/types/char: V>
  c  "kk_string_to_chars"
  cs inline "Primitive.StringToChars(#1)"
  js inline "_string_to_chars(#1)"

// Convert a string to a list of characters
pub extern string/liststd/core/string/list: (s : string) -> list<char>( ss: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V ) : totalstd/core/types/total: E liststd/core/list: V -> V<charstd/core/types/char: V>
  c  "kk_string_to_list"
  cs inline "Primitive.StringToList(#1)"
  js inline "_string_to_list(#1)"

// Convert a list of characters to a string
pub extern listchar/stringstd/core/listchar/string: (cs : list<char>) -> string( cscs: list<char> : liststd/core/list: V -> V<charstd/core/types/char: V> ) : totalstd/core/types/total: E stringstd/core/types/string: V
  c  "kk_string_from_list"
  cs inline "Primitive.ListToString(#1)"
  js inline "_list_to_string(#1)"

// Are two strings equal?
// Uses exact equality between character codes.
pub inline extern string/(==)std/core/string/(==): (string, string) -> bool : (stringstd/core/types/string: V,stringstd/core/types/string: V) -> boolstd/core/types/bool: V
  c  "kk_string_is_eq"
  cs inline "(#1 == #2)"
  js inline "(#1 === #2)"

// Are two strings not equal?
pub inline extern string/(!=)std/core/string/(!=): (string, string) -> bool : (stringstd/core/types/string: V,stringstd/core/types/string: V) -> boolstd/core/types/bool: V
  c  "kk_string_is_neq"
  inline "(#1 != #2)"
  js inline "(#1 !== #2)"

pub inline fun sslice/(==)std/core/sslice/(==): (l1 : sslice, l2 : sslice) -> bool(l1l1: sslice: sslicestd/core/sslice: V, l2l2: sslice: sslicestd/core/sslice: V ): boolstd/core/types/bool: V
  match (std/core/types/Tuple2: forall<a,b> (fst : a, snd : b) -> (a, b)l1l1: sslice, l2l2: sslice)std/core/types/Tuple2: forall<a,b> (fst : a, snd : b) -> (a, b)
    (std/core/types/Tuple2: forall<a,b> (fst : a, snd : b) -> (a, b)Sslicestd/core/Sslice: (str : string, start : int, len : int) -> sslice(s1s1: string, i1i1: int, f1f1: int), Sslicestd/core/Sslice: (str : string, start : int, len : int) -> sslice(s2s2: string, i2i2: int, f2f2: int))std/core/types/Tuple2: forall<a,b> (fst : a, snd : b) -> (a, b) ->
      if f1f1: int !=std/core/int/(!=): (x : int, y : int) -> bool f2f2: int then Falsestd/core/types/False: bool
      elif i1i1: int !=std/core/int/(!=): (x : int, y : int) -> bool i2i2: int then Falsestd/core/types/False: bool
      else s1s1: string ==std/core/string/(==): (string, string) -> bool s2s2: string

pub inline fun sslice/(!=)std/core/sslice/(!=): (l1 : sslice, l2 : sslice) -> bool(l1l1: sslice: sslicestd/core/sslice: V, l2l2: sslice: sslicestd/core/sslice: V ): boolstd/core/types/bool: V
  match (std/core/types/Tuple2: forall<a,b> (fst : a, snd : b) -> (a, b)l1l1: sslice, l2l2: sslice)std/core/types/Tuple2: forall<a,b> (fst : a, snd : b) -> (a, b)
    (std/core/types/Tuple2: forall<a,b> (fst : a, snd : b) -> (a, b)Sslicestd/core/Sslice: (str : string, start : int, len : int) -> sslice(s1s1: string, i1i1: int, f1f1: int), Sslicestd/core/Sslice: (str : string, start : int, len : int) -> sslice(s2s2: string, i2i2: int, f2f2: int))std/core/types/Tuple2: forall<a,b> (fst : a, snd : b) -> (a, b) ->
      if f1f1: int !=std/core/int/(!=): (x : int, y : int) -> bool f2f2: int then Truestd/core/types/True: bool
      elif i1i1: int !=std/core/int/(!=): (x : int, y : int) -> bool i2i2: int then Truestd/core/types/True: bool
      else s1s1: string !=std/core/string/(!=): (string, string) -> bool s2s2: string

extern string-cmpstd/core/string-cmp: (x : string, y : string) -> int : ( x : stringstd/core/types/string: V, y : stringstd/core/types/string: V ) -> intstd/core/types/int: V
  c  "kk_string_cmp_int"
  cs inline "String.Compare(#1,#2)"
  js inline "(#1===#2 ? 0 : (#1 > #2 ? 1 : -1))"

// Compare two strings.
// Uses the character codes directly for comparison
pub fun string/cmpstd/core/string/cmp: (x : string, y : string) -> order( xx: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V, yy: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V) : orderstd/core/types/order: V
  string-cmpstd/core/string-cmp: (x : string, y : string) -> int(xx: string,yy: string).orderstd/core/int/order: (i : int) -> order

pub fun string/(>=)std/core/string/(>=): (x : string, y : string) -> bool( xx: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V, yy: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V ) : boolstd/core/types/bool: V { cmpstd/core/string/cmp: (x : string, y : string) -> order(xx: string,yy: string) >std/core/order/(>): (x : order, y : order) -> bool Ltstd/core/types/Lt: order }
pub fun string/(<=)std/core/string/(<=): (x : string, y : string) -> bool( xx: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V, yy: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V ) : boolstd/core/types/bool: V { cmpstd/core/string/cmp: (x : string, y : string) -> order(xx: string,yy: string) <std/core/order/(<): (x : order, y : order) -> bool Gtstd/core/types/Gt: order }
pub fun string/(>)std/core/string/(>): (x : string, y : string) -> bool( xx: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V, yy: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V ) : boolstd/core/types/bool: V  { cmpstd/core/string/cmp: (x : string, y : string) -> order(xx: string,yy: string) ==std/core/order/(==): (x : order, y : order) -> bool Gtstd/core/types/Gt: order }
pub fun string/(<)std/core/string/(<): (x : string, y : string) -> bool( xx: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V, yy: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V ) : boolstd/core/types/bool: V  { cmpstd/core/string/cmp: (x : string, y : string) -> order(xx: string,yy: string) ==std/core/order/(==): (x : order, y : order) -> bool Ltstd/core/types/Lt: order }

// Append two strings.
pub extern string/(++)std/core/string/(++): (x : string, y : string) -> string(xx: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V, yy: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V) : stringstd/core/types/string: V
  c "kk_string_cat"
  inline "(#1 + #2)"

// Choose a non-empty string
pub fun string/(||)std/core/string/(||): (x : string, y : string) -> string( xx: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V, yy: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V ) : stringstd/core/types/string: V
  if xx: string.is-emptystd/core/string/is-empty: (s : string) -> bool then yy: string else xx: string

// Length returns the length in the platform specific encoding (and should not be exported)
inline extern string/lengthstd/core/string/length: (s : string) -> int( s : stringstd/core/types/string: V ) : intstd/core/types/int: V
  c inline "kk_string_len_int(#1,kk_context())"
  cs inline "#1.Length"
  js inline "#1.length"

// O(n). Return the number of characters in a string.
pub extern string/countstd/core/string/count: (s : string) -> int( ss: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V ) : intstd/core/types/int: V
  c  "kk_string_count_int"
  cs "Primitive.StringCount"
  js "_string_count"

// O(n). Return the number of characters in a string slice
pub extern sslice/countstd/core/sslice/count: (slice : sslice) -> int( sliceslice: sslice : sslicestd/core/sslice: V ) : intstd/core/types/int: V
  c  "kk_slice_count"
  cs "Primitive.SliceCount"
  js "_sslice_count"

extern first1std/core/first1: (s : string) -> sslice(ss: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V ) : sslicestd/core/sslice: V
  c  "kk_slice_first"
  cs "Primitive.SliceFirst"
  js "_sslice_first"

extern last1std/core/last1: (s : string) -> sslice(ss: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V ) : sslicestd/core/sslice: V
  c  "kk_slice_last"
  cs "Primitive.SliceLast"
  js "_sslice_last"

// O(`n`). The first `n` (default = `1`) characters in a string.
pub fun firststd/core/first: (s : string, n : ? int) -> sslice(ss: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V, nn: ? int : intstd/core/types/optional: V -> V = 1) : sslicestd/core/sslice: V
  val sliceslice: sslice = ss: string.first1std/core/first1: (s : string) -> sslice
  if nn: int==std/core/int/(==): (x : int, y : int) -> bool1 then sliceslice: sslice else sliceslice: sslice.extendstd/core/extend: (slice : sslice, count : int) -> sslice( nn: int -std/core/int/(-): (x : int, y : int) -> int 1 )

// O(`n`). The last `n` (default = `1`) characters in a string
pub fun string/laststd/core/string/last: (s : string, n : ? int) -> sslice(ss: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V, nn: ? int : intstd/core/types/optional: V -> V = 1) : sslicestd/core/sslice: V
  val sliceslice: sslice = ss: string.last1std/core/last1: (s : string) -> sslice
  if nn: int==std/core/int/(==): (x : int, y : int) -> bool1 then sliceslice: sslice
            else sliceslice: sslice.advancestd/core/advance: (slice : sslice, count : int) -> sslice(1 -std/core/int/(-): (x : int, y : int) -> int nn: int).extendstd/core/extend: (slice : sslice, count : int) -> sslice(nn: int -std/core/int/(-): (x : int, y : int) -> int 1)

// O(1). The entire string as a slice
pub fun slicestd/core/slice: (s : string) -> sslice( ss: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V ) : sslicestd/core/sslice: V
  Sslicestd/core/Sslice: (str : string, start : int, len : int) -> sslice(ss: string,0,ss: string.lengthstd/core/string/length: (s : string) -> int)

// An empty slice
val emptystd/core/empty: sslice = Sslicestd/core/Sslice: (str : string, start : int, len : int) -> sslice("",0,0)

// Is a slice empty?
pub fun sslice/is-emptystd/core/sslice/is-empty: (slice : sslice) -> bool( sliceslice: sslice : sslicestd/core/sslice: V ) : boolstd/core/types/bool: V
  !std/core/types/bool/(!): (b : bool) -> boolsliceslice: sslice.lenstd/core/sslice/len: (sslice : sslice) -> int.is-posstd/core/is-pos: (i : int) -> bool

// An invalid slice
val invalidstd/core/invalid: sslice = Sslicestd/core/Sslice: (str : string, start : int, len : int) -> sslice("",-1,0)

// Is a slice invalid?
pub fun is-validstd/core/is-valid: (slice : sslice) -> bool( sliceslice: sslice : sslicestd/core/sslice: V ) : boolstd/core/types/bool: V
  sliceslice: sslice.startstd/core/sslice/start: (sslice : sslice) -> int >=std/core/int/(>=): (x : int, y : int) -> bool 0

// Is a slice not empty?
pub fun sslice/is-notemptystd/core/sslice/is-notempty: (slice : sslice) -> bool( sliceslice: sslice : sslicestd/core/sslice: V ) : boolstd/core/types/bool: V
  sliceslice: sslice.lenstd/core/sslice/len: (sslice : sslice) -> int.is-posstd/core/is-pos: (i : int) -> bool

// Return the first character of a string as a string (or the empty string)
pub fun string/headstd/core/string/head: (s : string) -> string( ss: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V ) : stringstd/core/types/string: V
  ss: string.firststd/core/first: (s : string, n : ? int) -> sslice.stringstd/core/string: (slice : sslice) -> string

// Return the tail of a string (or the empty string)
pub fun string/tailstd/core/string/tail: (s : string) -> string( ss: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V ) : stringstd/core/types/string: V
  ss: string.firststd/core/first: (s : string, n : ? int) -> sslice.afterstd/core/after: (slice : sslice) -> sslice.stringstd/core/string: (slice : sslice) -> string

// Return the common prefix of two strings (upto `upto` characters (default is minimum length of the two strings))
pub extern common-prefixstd/core/common-prefix: (s : string, t : string, upto : ? int) -> sslice(ss: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V, tt: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V, ^uptoupto: ? int : intstd/core/types/int: V = -1 ) : sslicestd/core/sslice: V
  c  "kk_slice_common_prefix_borrow"
  cs "Primitive.SliceCommonPrefix"
  js "_sslice_common_prefix"

// O(`count`). Advance the start position of a string slice by `count` characters
// up to the end of the string.
// A negative `count` advances the start position backwards upto the first position
// in a string.
// Maintains the character count of the original slice upto the end of the string.
// For example:
//
// * `"abc".first.advance(1).string == "b"`,
// * `"abc".first.advance(3).string == ""`,
// * `"abc".last.advance(-1).string == "b"`.
//
pub extern advancestd/core/advance: (slice : sslice, count : int) -> sslice( sliceslice: sslice : sslicestd/core/sslice: V, ^countcount: int : intstd/core/types/int: V ) : sslicestd/core/sslice: V
  c  "kk_slice_advance_borrow"
  cs "Primitive.SliceAdvance"
  js "_sslice_advance"

// O(`count`). Extend a string slice by `count` characters up to the end of the string.
// A negative `count` shrinks the slice up to the empty slice.
// For example:
//
// * `"abc".first.extend(1).string == "ab"`
// * `"abc".last.extend(-1).string == ""`
//
pub extern extendstd/core/extend: (slice : sslice, count : int) -> sslice( sliceslice: sslice : sslicestd/core/sslice: V, ^countcount: int : intstd/core/types/int: V ) : sslicestd/core/sslice: V
  c  "kk_slice_extend_borrow"
  cs "Primitive.SliceExtend"
  js "_sslice_extend"

// O(1). Return the string slice from the start of a string up to the
// start of `slice` argument.
pub fun beforestd/core/before: (slice : sslice) -> sslice(sliceslice: sslice : sslicestd/core/sslice: V) : sslicestd/core/sslice: V
  val Sslicestd/core/Sslice: (str : string, start : int, len : int) -> sslice(ss: string,startstart: int,_len) = sliceslice: sslice
  Sslicestd/core/Sslice: (str : string, start : int, len : int) -> sslice(ss: string,0,startstart: int)

// O(1). Return the string slice from the end of `slice` argument
// to the end of the string.
pub fun afterstd/core/after: (slice : sslice) -> sslice(sliceslice: sslice : sslicestd/core/sslice: V) : sslicestd/core/sslice: V
  val Sslicestd/core/Sslice: (str : string, start : int, len : int) -> sslice(ss: string,startstart: int,lenlen: int) = sliceslice: sslice
  Sslicestd/core/Sslice: (str : string, start : int, len : int) -> sslice(ss: string,startstart: int+std/core/int/(+): (x : int, y : int) -> intlenlen: int,ss: string.lengthstd/core/string/length: (s : string) -> int -std/core/int/(-): (x : int, y : int) -> int (startstart: int+std/core/int/(+): (x : int, y : int) -> intlenlen: int))

// O(n). Copy the `slice` argument into a fresh string.
// Takes O(1) time if the slice covers the entire string.
pub extern stringstd/core/string: (slice : sslice) -> string( sliceslice: sslice : sslicestd/core/sslice: V ) : stringstd/core/types/string: V
  c  "kk_slice_to_string"
  cs "Primitive.SliceToString"
  js "_slice_to_string"

// If the slice is not empty,
// return the first character, and a new slice that is advanced by 1.
pub extern nextstd/core/next: (slice : sslice) -> maybe<(char, sslice)>( sliceslice: sslice : sslicestd/core/sslice: V ) : maybestd/core/types/maybe: V -> V<(std/core/types/tuple2: (V, V) -> Vcharstd/core/types/char: V,sslicestd/core/sslice: V)>
  c  "kk_slice_next"
  cs "Primitive.SliceNext"
  js "_sslice_next"

// Truncates a slice to length 0
pub fun sslice/truncatestd/core/sslice/truncate: (slice : sslice) -> sslice( sliceslice: sslice: sslicestd/core/sslice: V ): sslicestd/core/sslice: V
  Sslicestd/core/Sslice: (str : string, start : int, len : int) -> sslice(sliceslice: sslice.strstd/core/sslice/str: (sslice : sslice) -> string, sliceslice: sslice.startstd/core/sslice/start: (sslice : sslice) -> int, 0)

// Gets up to (`end`-`start`) characters from the slice beginning from `start`.
// If either start or end is negative, returns the original slice
pub fun subslicestd/core/subslice: (slice : sslice, start : int, end : int) -> sslice( sliceslice: sslice: sslicestd/core/sslice: V, startstart: int : intstd/core/types/int: V, endend: int : intstd/core/types/int: V ): sslicestd/core/sslice: V
  if startstart: int <std/core/int/(<): (x : int, y : int) -> bool 0 ||std/core/types/(||): (x : bool, y : bool) -> bool endend: int <std/core/int/(<): (x : int, y : int) -> bool 0 then sliceslice: sslice else
    // Advances to start, zeros the length, and then extends (end - start characters)
    sliceslice: sslice.advancestd/core/advance: (slice : sslice, count : int) -> sslice(startstart: int).truncatestd/core/sslice/truncate: (slice : sslice) -> sslice.extendstd/core/extend: (slice : sslice, count : int) -> sslice(endend: int -std/core/int/(-): (x : int, y : int) -> int startstart: int)

// Gets a slice that only includes up to n characters from the start of the slice.
pub fun sslice/takestd/core/sslice/take: (slice : sslice, n : int) -> sslice( sliceslice: sslice: sslicestd/core/sslice: V, nn: int : intstd/core/types/int: V): sslicestd/core/sslice: V
  if nn: int <=std/core/int/(<=): (x : int, y : int) -> bool 0 then returnreturn: sslice sliceslice: sslice else sliceslice: sslice.truncatestd/core/sslice/truncate: (slice : sslice) -> sslice.extendstd/core/extend: (slice : sslice, count : int) -> sslice(nn: int)

// Gets a slice that drops the first n characters, shrinking the length of the slice by n accordingly.
// If the slice does not have n characters, then the slice is shrunk to an empty slice.
//
// If maintaining the length of the slice is important, use `advance` instead.
pub fun sslice/dropstd/core/sslice/drop: (slice : sslice, n : int) -> sslice( sliceslice: sslice: sslicestd/core/sslice: V, nn: int : intstd/core/types/int: V): sslicestd/core/sslice: V
  if nn: int <=std/core/int/(<=): (x : int, y : int) -> bool 0 then returnreturn: sslice sliceslice: sslice else sliceslice: sslice.advancestd/core/advance: (slice : sslice, count : int) -> sslice(nn: int).truncatestd/core/sslice/truncate: (slice : sslice) -> sslice.extendstd/core/extend: (slice : sslice, count : int) -> sslice(sliceslice: sslice.countstd/core/sslice/count: (slice : sslice) -> int -std/core/int/(-): (x : int, y : int) -> int nn: int)

// Apply a function for each character in a string slice.
// If `action` returns `Just`, the function returns immediately with that result.
pub fun slice/foreach-whilestd/core/slice/foreach-while: forall<a,e> (slice : sslice, action : (c : char) -> e maybe<a>) -> e maybe<a>( sliceslice: sslice : sslicestd/core/sslice: V, actionaction: (c : char) -> $7895 maybe<$7894> : (c : charstd/core/types/char: V) -> ee: E maybestd/core/types/maybe: V -> V<aa: V> ) : ee: E maybestd/core/types/maybe: V -> V<aa: V>
  match sliceslice: sslice.nextstd/core/next: (slice : sslice) -> $7895 maybe<(char, sslice)>
    Nothingstd/core/types/Nothing: forall<a> maybe<a> -> Nothingstd/core/types/Nothing: forall<a> maybe<a>
    Juststd/core/types/Just: forall<a> (value : a) -> maybe<a>((std/core/types/Tuple2: forall<a,b> (fst : a, snd : b) -> (a, b)cc: char,restrest: sslice)std/core/types/Tuple2: forall<a,b> (fst : a, snd : b) -> (a, b)) ->
      match actionaction: (c : char) -> $7895 maybe<$7894>(cc: char)
        Nothingstd/core/types/Nothing: forall<a> maybe<a> -> slice/foreach-whilestd/core/slice/foreach-while: (slice : sslice, action : (c : char) -> $7895 maybe<$7894>) -> $7895 maybe<$7894>(unsafe-decreasingstd/core/types/unsafe-decreasing: (x : sslice) -> $7895 sslice(restrest: sslice),actionaction: (c : char) -> $7895 maybe<$7894>)
        resres: maybe<$7894>     -> resres: maybe<$7894>

// Does string `s`  contain the string `sub`  ?
inline extern xindex-ofstd/core/xindex-of: (s : string, sub : string) -> ssize_t(s : stringstd/core/types/string: V, sub : stringstd/core/types/string: V ) : ssize_tstd/core/types/ssize_t: V

  cs inline "((#1).IndexOf(#2) + 1)"
  js inline "((#1).indexOf(#2) + 1)"

// O(n). If it occurs, return the position of substring `sub` in `s`, tupled with
// the position just following the substring `sub`.
pub fun string/findstd/core/string/find: (s : string, sub : string) -> maybe<sslice>( ss: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V, subsub: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V ) : maybestd/core/types/maybe: V -> V<sslicestd/core/sslice: V>

inline extern xstarts-withstd/core/xstarts-with: (s : string, pre : string) -> bool: (s : stringstd/core/types/string: V, pre : stringstd/core/types/string: V ) -> boolstd/core/types/bool: V

  js inline "(#1.substr(0,#2.length) === #2)"

// Is `pre`  a prefix of `s`? If so, returns a slice
// of `s` following `pre` up to the end of `s`.
pub fun starts-withstd/core/starts-with: (s : string, pre : string) -> maybe<sslice>( ss: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V, prepre: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V ) : maybestd/core/types/maybe: V -> V<sslicestd/core/sslice: V>

extern xends-withstd/core/xends-with: (s : string, post : string) -> bool: (s : stringstd/core/types/string: V, post : stringstd/core/types/string: V ) -> boolstd/core/types/bool: V

  cs inline "#1.EndsWith(#2)"
  js inline "((#1).indexOf(#2, (#1).length - (#2).length) !== -1)"

// Does string `s`  end with `post`?
// If so, returns a slice of `s` from the start up to the `post` string at the end.

// Convert a `:maybe` string to a string using the empty sting for `Nothing`
pub fun maybe/stringstd/core/maybe/string: (ms : maybe<string>) -> string( msms: maybe<string> : maybestd/core/types/maybe: V -> V<stringstd/core/types/string: V> ) : stringstd/core/types/string: V
  match msms: maybe<string>
    Nothingstd/core/types/Nothing: forall<a> maybe<a> -> ""
    Juststd/core/types/Just: forall<a> (value : a) -> maybe<a>(ss: string) -> ss: string

  ss: string ==std/core/string/(==): (string, string) -> bool ""

// Transform a string to a maybe type, using `Nothing` for an empty string

// Split a string into parts that were delimited by `sep`. The delimeters are not included in the results.
// For example: `split("1,,2",",") == ["1","","2]`
pub fun string/splitstd/core/string/split: (s : string, sep : string) -> list<string>( ss: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V, sepsep: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V ) : liststd/core/list: V -> V<stringstd/core/types/string: V>
  splitvstd/core/splitv: (s : string, sep : string) -> vector<string>(ss: string,sepsep: string).liststd/core/vector/list: (v : vector<string>) -> list<string>

// Split a string into at most `n` parts that were delimited by a string `sep`. The delimeters are not included in the results (except for possibly the final part).
// For example: `split("1,2,3",",",2) == ["1","2,3"]`
pub fun splitn/splitstd/core/splitn/split: (s : string, sep : string, n : int) -> list<string>( ss: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V, sepsep: string: stringstd/core/types/string: V, ^nn: int : intstd/core/types/int: V) : liststd/core/list: V -> V<stringstd/core/types/string: V>
  splitvnstd/core/splitvn: (s : string, sep : string, n : ssize_t) -> vector<string>(ss: string,sepsep: string,nn: int.ssize_tstd/core/ssize_t: (i : int) -> ssize_t).liststd/core/vector/list: (v : vector<string>) -> list<string>

// Replace every occurrence of `pattern` to `repl` in a string.
pub inline extern replace-allstd/core/replace-all: (s : string, pattern : string, repl : string) -> string( s : stringstd/core/types/string: V, pattern : stringstd/core/types/string: V, repl : stringstd/core/types/string: V ) : stringstd/core/types/string: V
  c  "kk_string_replace_all"
  cs inline "(#1).Replace(#2,#3)"
  js inline "(#1).replace(new RegExp((#2).replace(/[\\\\\\$\\^*+\\-{}?().]/g,'\\\\$&'),'g'),#3)"

// Count occurences of `pattern` in a string.
pub inline extern stringpat/countstd/core/stringpat/count: (s : string, pattern : string) -> int( s : stringstd/core/types/string: V, pattern : stringstd/core/types/string: V ) : intstd/core/types/int: V
  c  "kk_string_count_pattern"
  cs inline "Primitive.Count(#1,#2)"
  js inline "((#2) ? ((#1).match(new RegExp((#2).replace(/[\\\\\\$\\^*+\\-{}?().]/g,'\\\\$&'),'g'))||[]).length : 0)"

// Apply a function `f` to each character in a string

// Invoke a function for each character in a string.
// If `action` returns `Just`, the function returns immediately with that result.
pub fun string/foreach-whilestd/core/string/foreach-while: forall<a,e> (s : string, action : (c : char) -> e maybe<a>) -> e maybe<a>( ss: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V, actionaction: (c : char) -> $7942 maybe<$7941> : (c:charstd/core/types/char: V) -> ee: E maybestd/core/types/maybe: V -> V<aa: V> ) : ee: E maybestd/core/types/maybe: V -> V<aa: V>

// Invoke a function for each character in a string

// Return the first character of a string (or `Nothing` for the empty string).
pub fun head-charstd/core/head-char: (s : string) -> maybe<char>( ss: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V ) : maybestd/core/types/maybe: V -> V<charstd/core/types/char: V>
  ss: string.foreach-whilestd/core/string/foreach-while: (s : string, action : (c : char) -> maybe<char>) -> maybe<char>( Juststd/core/types/Just: forall<a> (value : a) -> maybe<a> )

// Invoke a function for each character in a string
//fun foreach( s : string, f : char -> e () ) : e ()

//

// Count the number of times a predicate is true for each character in a string
pub fun stringpred/countstd/core/stringpred/count: forall<e> (s : string, pred : (char) -> e bool) -> e int( ss: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V, predpred: (char) -> $8261 bool : (charstd/core/types/char: V) -> ee: E boolstd/core/types/bool: V ) : ee: E intstd/core/types/int: V
  var cntcnt: local-var<$8270,int> := 0
  ss: string.foreachstd/core/string/foreach: (s : string, action : (c : char) -> <local<$8270>|$8261> ()) -> <local<$8270>|$8261> () fnfn: (c : char) -> <local<$8270>|$8261> ()(cc: char)
    if mask_1: H<localstd/core/types/local: H -> X>{predpred: (char) -> $8261 bool(cc: char)} then cntcnt: local-var<$8270,int> :=std/core/types/local-set: (v : local-var<$8270,int>, assigned : int) -> <local<$8270>|$8261> () cntcnt: int+std/core/int/(+): (x : int, y : int) -> <local<$8270>|$8261> int1std/core/types/Unit: ()
  cntcnt: int

// Split a string into a list of lines

  ss: string.splitstd/core/string/split: (s : string, sep : string) -> list<string>("\n")

// Convert a string to upper-case
pub extern to-upperstd/core/to-upper: (s : string) -> string : (s : stringstd/core/types/string: V) -> stringstd/core/types/string: V
  c "kk_string_to_upper"
  cs inline "(#1).ToUpper()"
  js inline "(#1).toUpperCase()"

  c "kk_string_to_lower"
  cs inline "(#1).ToLower()"
  js inline "(#1).toLowerCase()"

// Convert the first character of a string to uppercase.

  ss: string.firststd/core/first: (s : string, n : ? int) -> sslice.stringstd/core/string: (slice : sslice) -> string.to-upperstd/core/to-upper: (s : string) -> string ++std/core/string/(++): (x : string, y : string) -> string ss: string.firststd/core/first: (s : string, n : ? int) -> sslice.afterstd/core/after: (slice : sslice) -> sslice.stringstd/core/string: (slice : sslice) -> string

// Right-align a string to width `width`  using `fill`  (default is a space) to fill from the left.
pub fun pad-leftstd/core/pad-left: (s : string, width : int, fill : ? char) -> string( ss: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V, ^widthwidth: int : intstd/core/types/int: V, fillfill: ? char : charstd/core/types/optional: V -> V = ' ') : stringstd/core/types/string: V

  val nn: int = ss: string.lengthstd/core/string/length: (s : string) -> int
  if ww: int <=std/core/int/(<=): (x : int, y : int) -> bool nn: int
    then ss: string
    else fillfill: char.stringstd/core/char/string: (c : char) -> string.repeatstd/core/string/repeat: (s : string, n : int) -> string( ww: int -std/core/int/(-): (x : int, y : int) -> int nn: int ) ++std/core/string/(++): (x : string, y : string) -> string ss: string

// Left-align a string to width `width`  using `fill`  (default is a space) to fill on the right.
pub fun pad-rightstd/core/pad-right: (s : string, width : int, fill : ? char) -> string( ss: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V, ^widthwidth: int : intstd/core/types/int: V, fillfill: ? char : charstd/core/types/optional: V -> V = ' ') : stringstd/core/types/string: V

  val nn: int = ss: string.lengthstd/core/string/length: (s : string) -> int

    then ss: string
    else ss: string ++std/core/string/(++): (x : string, y : string) -> string fillfill: char.stringstd/core/char/string: (c : char) -> string.repeatstd/core/string/repeat: (s : string, n : int) -> string(ww: int -std/core/int/(-): (x : int, y : int) -> int nn: int)

// Trim whitespace on the left and right side of a string
pub fun trimstd/core/trim: (s : string) -> string( ss: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V ) : stringstd/core/types/string: V
  ss: string.trim-leftstd/core/string/trim-left: (s : string) -> string.trim-rightstd/core/string/trim-right: (s : string) -> string

// Trim the starting white space of a string
pub inline extern string/trim-leftstd/core/string/trim-left: (s : string) -> string( s : stringstd/core/types/string: V ) : stringstd/core/types/string: V
  c  "kk_string_trim_left"
  cs inline "(#1).TrimStart()"
  js inline "((#1).replace(/^\\s\\s*/,''))"

// Trim the ending white space of a string.
pub inline extern string/trim-rightstd/core/string/trim-right: (s : string) -> string( s : stringstd/core/types/string: V ) : stringstd/core/types/string: V
  c  "kk_string_trim_right"
  cs inline "(#1).TrimEnd()"
  js inline "((#1).replace(/\\s+$/,''))"

  cs inline "(#1)[#2]"
  js inline "(#1)[#2]"

  cs inline "(#1)[#2] = #3"
  js inline "(#1)[#2] = #3"

  js inline "Array(#1)"

// Raise an out of bounds exception if `index < 0`  or `index >= v.length`.

// Invoke a function `f` for each element in a vector `v`.

// ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
// Delayed values
// ----------------------------------------------------------------------------

// Delayed (or _lazy_) values are computed (with effect `:e`) only the first time
// `force` is called and cached afterwards.
abstract value type delayedstd/core/delayed: (E, V) -> V<ee: E,aa: V>
  con XDelaystd/core/XDelay: forall<e,a> (dref : ref<global,either<() -> e a,a>>) -> delayed<e,a>( drefstd/core/delayed/dref: forall<e,a> (delayed : delayed<e,a>) -> ref<global,either<() -> e a,a>> : refstd/core/types/ref: (H, V) -> V<globalstd/core/types/global: H,eitherstd/core/types/either: (V, V) -> V<() -> ee: E aa: V,aa: V>> )

// Create a new `:delayed` value.
pub fun delaystd/core/delay: forall<a,e> (action : () -> e a) -> delayed<e,a>( actionaction: () -> $3401 $3400 : () -> ee: E aa: V ) : delayedstd/core/delayed: (E, V) -> V<ee: E,aa: V>
  unsafe-totalstd/core/types/unsafe-total: (action : () -> <alloc<global>|_3419> delayed<$3401,$3400>) -> delayed<$3401,$3400>
    val rr: ref<global,either<() -> $3401 $3400,$3400>> : refstd/core/types/ref: (H, V) -> V<globalstd/core/types/global: H,eitherstd/core/types/either: (V, V) -> V<__w-l2113-c31: V,__w-l2113-c33: V>> = refstd/core/types/ref: (value : either<() -> $3401 $3400,$3400>) -> <alloc<global>|_3419> ref<global,either<() -> $3401 $3400,$3400>>(Leftstd/core/types/Left: forall<a,b> (left : a) -> either<a,b>(actionaction: () -> $3401 $3400))
    XDelaystd/core/XDelay: forall<e,a> (dref : ref<global,either<() -> e a,a>>) -> delayed<e,a>(rr: ref<global,either<() -> $3401 $3400,$3400>>)

// Force a delayed value; the value is computed only on the first
// call to `force` and cached afterwards.
pub fun forcestd/core/force: forall<a,e> (delayed : delayed<e,a>) -> e a( delayeddelayed: delayed<$3602,$3601> : delayedstd/core/delayed: (E, V) -> V<ee: E,aa: V> ) : ee: E aa: V
  unsafe-totalstd/core/types/unsafe-total: (action : () -> <alloc<global>,div,read<global>,write<global>|$3602> $3601) -> $3602 $3601
    val rr: ref<global,either<() -> $3602 $3601,$3601>> = delayeddelayed: delayed<$3602,$3601>.drefstd/core/delayed/dref: (delayed : delayed<$3602,$3601>) -> <alloc<global>,div,read<global>,write<global>|$3602> ref<global,either<() -> $3602 $3601,$3601>>
    match !std/core/types/ref/(!): (ref : ref<global,either<() -> $3602 $3601,$3601>>) -> <read<global>,div,alloc<_3659>,write<global>|$3602> either<() -> $3602 $3601,$3601>rr: ref<global,either<() -> $3602 $3601,$3601>>
      Rightstd/core/types/Right: forall<a,b> (right : b) -> either<a,b>(xx: $3601) -> xx: $3601
      Leftstd/core/types/Left: forall<a,b> (left : a) -> either<a,b>(actionaction: () -> $3602 $3601) ->
        val xx: $3601 = (inject-ststd/core/inject-st: (() -> <div|$3602> $3601) -> <alloc<global>,div,read<global>,write<global>|$3602> (() -> <st<global>,div|$3602> $3601){mask<divstd/core/types/div: X>(actionaction: () -> $3602 $3601)})()
        rr: ref<global,either<() -> $3602 $3601,$3601>> :=std/core/types/set: (ref : ref<global,either<() -> $3602 $3601,$3601>>, assigned : either<() -> $3602 $3601,$3601>) -> <write<global>,alloc<global>,div,read<global>|$3602> () Rightstd/core/types/Right: forall<a,b> (right : b) -> either<a,b>(xx: $3601)
        xx: $3601

// ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
// Show
// ----------------------------------------------------------------------------

// Generic show: shows the internal representation of an object as a string
// Note: this breaks parametricity so it should not be public
extern gshowstd/core/gshow: forall<a> (a) -> string : forall<aa: V> aa: V -> stringstd/core/types/string: V
  c "kk_show_any"
  cs inline "#1.ToString()"
  js inline "#1.toString()"

// Convert an `:int` to a string
pub extern int/showstd/core/int/show: (i : int) -> string( ii: int : intstd/core/types/int: V ) : stringstd/core/types/string: V
  c "kk_integer_to_string"
  cs inline "#1.ToString()"
  js inline "#1.toString()"

extern int-show-hexstd/core/int-show-hex: (i : int, use-capitals : bool) -> string(ii: int:intstd/core/types/int: V,use-capitalsuse-capitals: bool:boolstd/core/types/bool: V) : stringstd/core/types/string: V
  c "kk_integer_to_hex_string"
  cs "Primitive.IntShowHex"
  js "_int_showhex"

// Show an `:int` as a hexadecimal value.\
// The `width`  parameter specifies how wide the hex value is where `"0"`  is used to align.\
// The `use-capitals` parameter (= `True`) determines if captical letters should be used to display the hexadecimal digits.\
// The `pre` (=`"0x"`) is an optional prefix for the number (goes between the sign and the number).
pub fun int/show-hexstd/core/int/show-hex: (i : int, width : ? int, use-capitals : ? bool, pre : ? string) -> string( ii: int : intstd/core/types/int: V, widthwidth: ? int : intstd/core/types/optional: V -> V = 1, use-capitalsuse-capitals: ? bool : boolstd/core/types/optional: V -> V = Truestd/core/types/True: bool, prepre: ? string : stringstd/core/types/optional: V -> V = "0x" )
  (if ii: int<std/core/int/(<): (x : int, y : int) -> bool0 then "-" else "") ++std/core/string/(++): (x : string, y : string) -> string prepre: string ++std/core/string/(++): (x : string, y : string) -> string int-show-hexstd/core/int-show-hex: (i : int, use-capitals : bool) -> string(ii: int.absstd/core/int/abs: (i : int) -> int,use-capitalsuse-capitals: bool).pad-leftstd/core/pad-left: (s : string, width : int, fill : ? char) -> string(widthwidth: int,'0')


// Show a `:float64` as a string.
// If `d >= 1.0e-5` and `d < 1.0e+21`, `show-fixed` is used and otherwise `show-exp`.
// Default `precision` is `-17`.
pub fun float64/showstd/core/float64/show: (d : float64, precision : ? int) -> string( dd: float64 : float64std/core/types/float64: V, precisionprecision: ? int : intstd/core/types/optional: V -> V = -17 ) : stringstd/core/types/string: V
  val dabsdabs: float64 = dd: float64.absstd/core/float64/abs: (f : float64) -> float64
  if dabsdabs: float64 >=std/core/float64/(>=): (float64, float64) -> bool 1.0e-5 &&std/core/types/(&&): (x : bool, y : bool) -> bool dabsdabs: float64 <std/core/float64/(<): (float64, float64) -> bool 1.0e+21
    then show-fixedstd/core/float64/show-fixed: (d : float64, precision : ? int) -> string(dd: float64,precisionprecision: int)
    else show-expstd/core/float64/show-exp: (d : float64, precision : ? int) -> string(dd: float64,precisionprecision: int)

// Show a `:float64` fixed-point notation.
// The optional `precision` (= `-2`) specifies the maximum precision.
// If `>=0` it specifies the number of digits behind the dot (up to `20` max).
// If negative, then at most the absolute value of `precision` digits behind the dot are used.
// This may still show a number in exponential notation if the it is too small or large,
// in particular, for  a `d` where `d > 1.0e21` or `d < 1.0e-15`, or if
// `precision.abs > 17`, the `show-exp` routine is used.
pub fun float64/show-fixedstd/core/float64/show-fixed: (d : float64, precision : ? int) -> string( dd: float64 : float64std/core/types/float64: V, precisionprecision: ? int : intstd/core/types/optional: V -> V = -2 ) : stringstd/core/types/string: V
  val dabsdabs: float64 = dd: float64.absstd/core/float64/abs: (f : float64) -> float64
  if dabsdabs: float64 <std/core/float64/(<): (float64, float64) -> bool 1.0e-15 ||std/core/types/(||): (x : bool, y : bool) -> bool dabsdabs: float64 >std/core/float64/(>): (float64, float64) -> bool 1.0e+21
    then show-expstd/core/float64/show-exp: (d : float64, precision : ? int) -> string(dd: float64,precisionprecision: int)
    else show-fixedxstd/core/show-fixedx: (d : float64, prec : int32) -> string(dd: float64, precisionprecision: int.int32std/core/int32: (i : int) -> int32)

extern show-fixedxstd/core/show-fixedx: (d : float64, prec : int32) -> string( dd: float64 : float64std/core/types/float64: V, precprec: int32 : int32std/core/types/int32: V ) : stringstd/core/types/string: V
  c  "kk_double_show_fixed"
  cs "Primitive.DoubleShowFixed"
  js "_double_show_fixed"

// Show a `:float64` in exponential (scientific) notation.
// The optional `precision` (= `-17`) specifies the precision.
// If `>=0` it specifies the number of digits behind the dot (up to `17` max).
// If negative, then at most the absolute value of `precision` digits behind the dot are used.
pub fun float64/show-expstd/core/float64/show-exp: (d : float64, precision : ? int) -> string( dd: float64 : float64std/core/types/float64: V, precisionprecision: ? int : intstd/core/types/optional: V -> V = -17 )
  show-expxstd/core/show-expx: (d : float64, prec : int32) -> string(dd: float64,precisionprecision: int.int32std/core/int32: (i : int) -> int32)

extern show-expxstd/core/show-expx: (d : float64, prec : int32) -> string( dd: float64 : float64std/core/types/float64: V, precprec: int32 : int32std/core/types/int32: V ) : stringstd/core/types/string: V
  c  "kk_double_show_exp"
  cs "Primitive.DoubleShowExp"
  js "_double_show_exp"

// Show a character as a string
pub fun show-charstd/core/show-char: (c : char) -> string( cc: char : charstd/core/types/char: V ) : stringstd/core/types/string: V

  if cc: char <std/core/char/(<): (char, char) -> bool ' ' ||std/core/types/(||): (x : bool, y : bool) -> bool cc: char >std/core/char/(>): (char, char) -> bool '~' then
    if cc: char ==std/core/char/(==): (char, char) -> bool '\n' then "\\n"
    elif cc: char ==std/core/char/(==): (char, char) -> bool '\r' then "\\r"
    elif cc: char ==std/core/char/(==): (char, char) -> bool '\t' then "\\t"
    elif cc: char.intstd/core/char/int: (char) -> int <=std/core/int/(<=): (x : int, y : int) -> bool 0xFF then "\\x" ++std/core/string/(++): (x : string, y : string) -> string cc: char.intstd/core/char/int: (char) -> int.show-hexstd/core/int/show-hex: (i : int, width : ? int, use-capitals : ? bool, pre : ? string) -> string(2,pre="")
    elif cc: char.intstd/core/char/int: (char) -> int <=std/core/int/(<=): (x : int, y : int) -> bool 0xFFFF then "\\u" ++std/core/string/(++): (x : string, y : string) -> string cc: char.intstd/core/char/int: (char) -> int.show-hexstd/core/int/show-hex: (i : int, width : ? int, use-capitals : ? bool, pre : ? string) -> string(4,pre="")
    else "\\U" ++std/core/string/(++): (x : string, y : string) -> string cc: char.intstd/core/char/int: (char) -> int.show-hexstd/core/int/show-hex: (i : int, width : ? int, use-capitals : ? bool, pre : ? string) -> string(6,pre="")
  else
    if cc: char ==std/core/char/(==): (char, char) -> bool '\'' then "\\'"
    elif cc: char ==std/core/char/(==): (char, char) -> bool '"' then "\\\""
    elif cc: char ==std/core/char/(==): (char, char) -> bool '\\' then "\\\\"
    else cc: char.stringstd/core/char/string: (c : char) -> string

// Show a `:char` as a character literal
pub fun char/showstd/core/char/show: (c : char) -> string( cc: char : charstd/core/types/char: V ) : stringstd/core/types/string: V
  "'" ++std/core/string/(++): (x : string, y : string) -> string cc: char.show-charstd/core/show-char: (c : char) -> string ++std/core/string/(++): (x : string, y : string) -> string "'"

// Show a string as a string literal
pub noinline fun string/showstd/core/string/show: (s : string) -> string( ss: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V ) : stringstd/core/types/string: V
  "\"" ++std/core/string/(++): (x : string, y : string) -> string ss: string.liststd/core/string/list: (s : string) -> list<char>.mapstd/core/list/map: (xs : list<char>, f : (char) -> string) -> list<string>(show-charstd/core/show-char: (c : char) -> string).joinstd/core/join: (xs : list<string>) -> string ++std/core/string/(++): (x : string, y : string) -> string "\""

// Convert a `:bool` to a string
pub fun bool/showstd/core/bool/show: (b : bool) -> string( bb: bool : boolstd/core/types/bool: V ) : stringstd/core/types/string: V
  if bb: bool then "True" else "False"

// Convert a unit value `()` to a string
pub fun unit/showstd/core/unit/show: (u : ()) -> string( uu: () : (std/core/types/unit: V)std/core/types/unit: V ) : stringstd/core/types/string: V
  "()"

// Show an `:sslice` as a string literal
pub fun sslice/showstd/core/sslice/show: (s : sslice) -> string( ss: sslice : sslicestd/core/sslice: V ) : stringstd/core/types/string: V
  ss: sslice.stringstd/core/string: (slice : sslice) -> string.showstd/core/string/show: (s : string) -> string

// Show a list
pub fun list/showstd/core/list/show: forall<a,e> (xs : list<a>, @implicit/show : (a) -> e string) -> e string( xsxs: list<$9185> : liststd/core/list: V -> V<aa: V>, @implicit/show@implicit/show: ($9185) -> $9186 string : aa: V -> ee: E stringstd/core/types/string: V ) : ee: E stringstd/core/types/string: V
  "[" ++std/core/string/(++): (x : string, y : string) -> $9186 string xsxs: list<$9185>.mapstd/core/list/map: (xs : list<$9185>, f : ($9185) -> $9186 string) -> $9186 list<string>(show@implicit/show: ($9185) -> $9186 string).joinstd/core/joinsep/join: (xs : list<string>, sep : string) -> $9186 string(",") ++std/core/string/(++): (x : string, y : string) -> $9186 string "]"

// Show a tuple
pub fun tuple2/showstd/core/tuple2/show: forall<a,b,e> (x : (a, b), @implicit/fst/show : (a) -> e string, @implicit/snd/show : (b) -> e string) -> e string( xx: ($9382, $9383) : (std/core/types/tuple2: (V, V) -> Vaa: V,bb: V), @implicit/fst/show@implicit/fst/show: ($9382) -> $9384 string : aa: V -> ee: E stringstd/core/types/string: V, @implicit/snd/show@implicit/snd/show: ($9383) -> $9384 string : bb: V -> ee: E stringstd/core/types/string: V) : ee: E stringstd/core/types/string: V

    Nothingstd/core/types/Nothing: forall<a> maybe<a> -> "Nothing"


// _deprecated_, use `list/show` instead.
