// ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
// Print to the console
// ----------------------------------------------------------------------------

// Generic print routine: prints the internal representation as a string to the console, including a final newline character.
// Note: this breaks parametricity so it should not be pub
fun gprintlnstd/core/gprintln: forall<a> (x : a) -> console ()( xx: $11966 : aa: V ) : consolestd/core/console: X (std/core/types/unit: V)std/core/types/unit: V
  printlnstd/core/string/println: (s : string) -> console ()( xx: $11966.gshowstd/core/gshow: ($11966) -> console string )

// Generic print routine: prints the internal representation as a string to the console,
// including a final newline character.
// Note: this breaks parametricity so it should not be pub
fun gprintstd/core/gprint: forall<a> (x : a) -> console ()( xx: $11921 : aa: V ) : consolestd/core/console: X (std/core/types/unit: V)std/core/types/unit: V
  printstd/core/string/print: (s : string) -> console ()( xx: $11921.gshowstd/core/gshow: ($11921) -> console string )

noinline val redirectstd/core/redirect: ref<global,maybe<(string) -> console ()>> : refstd/core/types/ref: (H, V) -> V<globalstd/core/types/global: H,maybestd/core/types/maybe: V -> V<(stringstd/core/types/string: V) -> consolestd/core/console: X (std/core/types/unit: V)std/core/types/unit: V>> =
  unsafe-totalstd/core/types/unsafe-total: (action : () -> <alloc<global>|_2314> ref<global,maybe<(string) -> console ()>>) -> ref<global,maybe<(string) -> console ()>> { refstd/core/types/ref: (value : maybe<(string) -> console ()>) -> <alloc<global>|_2314> ref<global,maybe<(string) -> console ()>>(Nothingstd/core/types/Nothing: forall<a> maybe<a>) }

// redirect `print` and `println` calls to a specified function.
noinline fun print-redirectstd/core/print-redirect: (print : (msg : string) -> console ()) -> io ()( printprint: (msg : string) -> console () : (msg : stringstd/core/types/string: V) -> consolestd/core/console: X (std/core/types/unit: V)std/core/types/unit: V ) : iostd/core/io: E (std/core/types/unit: V)std/core/types/unit: V
  redirectstd/core/redirect: ref<global,maybe<(string) -> console ()>> :=std/core/types/set: (ref : ref<global,maybe<(string) -> console ()>>, assigned : maybe<(string) -> console ()>) -> <write<global>,alloc<global>,console,div,exn,fsys,ndet,net,read<global>,ui> () Juststd/core/types/Just: forall<a> (value : a) -> maybe<a>(printprint: (msg : string) -> console ())

// Print a string to the console, including a final newline character.
extern xprintslnstd/core/xprintsln: (s : string) -> console ()(ss: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V) : consolestd/core/console: X (std/core/types/unit: V)std/core/types/unit: V
  c  "kk_println"
  cs "Console.WriteLine"
  js "_println"

// Print a string to the console
extern xprintsstd/core/xprints: (s : string) -> console ()( ss: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V) : consolestd/core/console: X (std/core/types/unit: V)std/core/types/unit: V
  c  "kk_print"
  cs "Console.Write"
  js "_print"

// _Unsafe_. This function removes the non-termination effect (`:div`) from the effect of an action
pub inline extern unsafe-nostatestd/core/unsafe-nostate: forall<a,h> (action : () -> <st<h>,console> a) -> (() -> console a)( action : () -> <std/core/types/total: Eststd/core/types/st: H -> E<hh: H>,consolestd/core/console: X> aa: V ) : ((std/core/types/total: E) -> consolestd/core/console: X aa: V)
  inline "#1"

noinline fun printsstd/core/prints: (s : string) -> console ()( ss: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V ) : consolestd/core/console: X (std/core/types/unit: V)std/core/types/unit: V
  (unsafe-nostatestd/core/unsafe-nostate: (action : () -> <st<global>,console> ()) -> console (() -> console ())
    match !std/core/types/ref/(!): (ref : ref<global,maybe<(string) -> console ()>>) -> <read<global>,console,alloc<_4703>,write<global>> maybe<(string) -> console ()>redirectstd/core/redirect: ref<global,maybe<(string) -> console ()>>
      Nothingstd/core/types/Nothing: forall<a> maybe<a> -> xprintsstd/core/xprints: (s : string) -> <console,read<global>,alloc<_4703>,write<global>> ()(ss: string)
      Juststd/core/types/Just: forall<a> (value : a) -> maybe<a>(ff: (string) -> console ()) -> ff: (string) -> <console,read<global>,alloc<_4703>,write<global>> ()(ss: string)
  )()

noinline fun printslnstd/core/printsln: (s : string) -> console ()( ss: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V ) : consolestd/core/console: X (std/core/types/unit: V)std/core/types/unit: V
  (unsafe-nostatestd/core/unsafe-nostate: (action : () -> <st<global>,console> ()) -> console (() -> console ())
    match !std/core/types/ref/(!): (ref : ref<global,maybe<(string) -> console ()>>) -> <read<global>,console,alloc<_9827>,write<global>> maybe<(string) -> console ()>redirectstd/core/redirect: ref<global,maybe<(string) -> console ()>>
      Nothingstd/core/types/Nothing: forall<a> maybe<a> -> xprintslnstd/core/xprintsln: (s : string) -> <console,read<global>,alloc<_9827>,write<global>> ()(ss: string)
      Juststd/core/types/Just: forall<a> (value : a) -> maybe<a>(ff: (string) -> console ()) -> ff: (string) -> <console,read<global>,alloc<_9827>,write<global>> ()(ss: string ++std/core/string/(++): (x : string, y : string) -> <console,read<global>,alloc<_9827>,write<global>> string "\n")
  )()

// Print a string to the console.
pub fun string/printstd/core/string/print: (s : string) -> console ()(ss: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V)
  printsstd/core/prints: (s : string) -> console ()(ss: string)

// Print a value that has a `show` function
pub fun show/printstd/core/show/print: forall<a> (x : a, @implicit/show : (a) -> string) -> console ()( xx: $11873 : aa: V, @implicit/show@implicit/show: ($11873) -> string : aa: V -> stringstd/core/types/string: V ) : consolestd/core/console: X (std/core/types/unit: V)std/core/types/unit: V
  printsstd/core/prints: (s : string) -> console ()(xx: $11873.show@implicit/show: ($11873) -> console string)

// Print a string to the console, including a final newline character.
pub fun string/printlnstd/core/string/println: (s : string) -> console ()(ss: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V) : consolestd/core/console: X (std/core/types/unit: V)std/core/types/unit: V
  printslnstd/core/printsln: (s : string) -> console ()(ss: string)

// Print a value that has a `show` function, including a final newline character.
pub fun show/printlnstd/core/show/println: forall<a> (x : a, @implicit/show : (a) -> string) -> console ()( xx: $9888 : aa: V, @implicit/show@implicit/show: ($9888) -> string : aa: V -> stringstd/core/types/string: V ) : consolestd/core/console: X (std/core/types/unit: V)std/core/types/unit: V
  printslnstd/core/printsln: (s : string) -> console ()(xx: $9888.show@implicit/show: ($9888) -> console string)

/*
// Print an integer to the console.
pub fun int/print(i : int)
  prints(show(i))

// Print a float64 to the console.
pub fun float64/print(d : float64)
  prints(show(d))

// Print a boolean to the console
pub fun bool/print( b : bool )
  prints(show(b))

// Print a character to the console.
pub fun char/print(c : char)
  prints(c.string)

// Print a unit value to the console
pub fun unit/print( u : () )
  prints(show(()))
*/

/*
// Print an integer to the console, including a final newline character.
pub fun int/println(i : int)
  printsln(show(i))

// Print a float64 to the console, including a final newline character.
pub fun float64/println(d : float64)
  printsln(show(d))

// Print a boolean to the console, including a final newline character
pub fun bool/println( b : bool )
  printsln(show(b))

// Print a character to the console, including a final newline character.
pub fun char/println(c : char)
  printsln(c.string)

// Print a unit value to the console, including a final newline character
pub fun unit/println( u : () )
  printsln(show(()))
*/

// ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
// Exceptions
// ----------------------------------------------------------------------------

// The `:named` effect is the default umbrella effect for named effects
pub type nmdstd/core/nmd: X :: X

pub type scopestd/core/scope: S -> X :: S -> X

// Exceptions
pub effect exnstd/core/exn: HX
  // Throw an exception
  ctl throw-exnstd/core/throw-exn: forall<a> (exn : exception) -> exn a( exnexn: exception : exceptionstd/core/exception: V ) : aa: V

pub fun "@default-exn"(actionaction: () -> <exn,console|$9936> () : () -> <exnstd/core/exn: HX,consolestd/core/console: X|std/core/types/effect-extend: (X, E) -> Eee: E> (std/core/types/unit: V)std/core/types/unit: V ) : <consolestd/core/console: X|std/core/types/effect-extend: (X, E) -> Eee: E> (std/core/types/unit: V)std/core/types/unit: V
  handlehandler: (() -> <exn,console|$9936> ()) -> <console|$9936> ()( actionaction: () -> <exn,console|$9936> () )
    final ctl throw-exnthrow-exn: (exn : exception) -> <console|$9936> ()( exnexn: exception : exceptionstd/core/exception: V )
      "uncaught exception: ".printsstd/core/prints: (s : string) -> <console|$9936> ()
      showstd/core/show: (exn : exception) -> <console|$9936> string(exnexn: exception).printlnstd/core/string/println: (s : string) -> <console|$9936> ()

// The exception data type
pub value struct exceptionstd/core/exception: V( messagestd/core/exception/message: (exception : exception) -> string :stringstd/core/types/string: V, infostd/core/exception/info: (exception : exception) -> exception-info :exception-infostd/core/exception-info: V )

// Exception information
pub open type exception-infostd/core/exception-info: V
  ExnErrorstd/core/ExnError: exception-info      // Generic error
  ExnAssertstd/core/ExnAssert: exception-info
  ExnTodostd/core/ExnTodo: exception-info
  ExnRangestd/core/ExnRange: exception-info
  ExnPatternstd/core/ExnPattern: (location : string, definition : string) -> exception-info( location : stringstd/core/types/string: V, definition : stringstd/core/types/string: V )
  ExnSystemstd/core/ExnSystem: (errno : int) -> exception-info( errno : intstd/core/types/int: V )
  ExnInternalstd/core/ExnInternal: (name : string) -> exception-info( name : stringstd/core/types/string: V )

// Show the exception message
pub fun showstd/core/show: (exn : exception) -> string( exnexn: exception : exceptionstd/core/exception: V ) : stringstd/core/types/string: V
  exnexn: exception.messagestd/core/exception/message: (exception : exception) -> string

// Throw an exception with a specified message.
pub fun throwstd/core/throw: forall<a> (message : string, info : ? exception-info) -> exn a( messagemessage: string: stringstd/core/types/string: V, infoinfo: ? exception-info : exception-infostd/core/types/optional: V -> V = ExnErrorstd/core/ExnError: exception-info ) : exnstd/core/exn: HX aa: V
  throw-exnstd/core/throw-exn: (exn : exception) -> exn $10277(Exceptionstd/core/Exception: (message : string, info : exception-info) -> exception(messagemessage: string,infoinfo: exception-info))

// Raise a pattern match exception. This is function is used internally by the
// compiler to generate error messages on pattern match failures.
pub fun error-patternstd/core/error-pattern: forall<a> (location : string, definition : string) -> exn a(locationlocation: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V, definitiondefinition: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V) : exnstd/core/exn: HX aa: V
  throwstd/core/throw: (message : string, info : ? exception-info) -> exn $11039(locationlocation: string ++std/core/string/(++): (x : string, y : string) -> exn string (if definitiondefinition: string.is-emptystd/core/string/is-empty: (s : string) -> exn bool then "" else (": " ++std/core/string/(++): (x : string, y : string) -> exn string definitiondefinition: string)) ++std/core/string/(++): (x : string, y : string) -> exn string ": pattern match failure",
         ExnPatternstd/core/ExnPattern: (location : string, definition : string) -> exception-info(locationlocation: string,definitiondefinition: string))

// Catch any exception raised in `action` and handle it.
// Use `on-exn` or `on-exit` when appropiate.
pub fun exn/trystd/core/exn/try: forall<a,e> (action : () -> <exn|e> a, hndl : (exception) -> e a) -> e a( actionaction: () -> <exn|$10572> $10571 : () -> <exnstd/core/exn: HX|std/core/types/effect-extend: (X, E) -> Eee: E> aa: V, hndlhndl: (exception) -> $10572 $10571: exceptionstd/core/exception: V -> ee: E aa: V ) : ee: E aa: V
  withhandler: (() -> <exn|$10572> $10571) -> $10572 $10571 final ctl throw-exnthrow-exn: (exn : exception) -> $10572 $10571(exnexn: exception) hndlhndl: (exception) -> $10572 $10571(exnexn: exception)
  actionaction: () -> <exn|$10572> $10571()

// _Deprecated_; use `try` instead. Catch an exception raised by `throw` and handle it.
// Use `on-exn` or `on-exit` when appropiate.

// An `:error` type represents a first-class exception result.
pub value type errorstd/core/error: V -> V<aa: V>
  Errorstd/core/Error: forall<a> (exception : exception) -> error<a>( exception : exceptionstd/core/exception: V )
  Okstd/core/Ok: forall<a> (result : a) -> error<a>( result : aa: V )

// Transform an exception effect to an  `:error` type.
pub fun error/trystd/core/error/try: forall<a,e> (action : () -> <exn|e> a) -> e error<a>( actionaction: () -> <exn|$10659> $10658 : () -> <exnstd/core/exn: HX|std/core/types/effect-extend: (X, E) -> Eee: E> aa: V ) : ee: E errorstd/core/error: V -> V<aa: V>
  trystd/core/exn/try: (action : () -> <exn|$10659> error<$10658>, hndl : (exception) -> $10659 error<$10658>) -> $10659 error<$10658>({ Okstd/core/Ok: forall<a> (result : a) -> error<a>(actionaction: () -> <exn|$10659> $10658()) }, fnfn: (exn : exception) -> $10659 error<$10658>(exnexn: exception){ Errorstd/core/Error: forall<a> (exception : exception) -> error<a>(exnexn: exception) })

// Return a default value when an exception is raised
pub fun try-defaultstd/core/try-default: forall<a,e> (value : a, action : () -> <exn|e> a) -> e a( valuevalue: $14508 : aa: V , actionaction: () -> <exn|$14509> $14508 : () -> <exnstd/core/exn: HX|std/core/types/effect-extend: (X, E) -> Eee: E> aa: V ) : ee: E aa: V
  trystd/core/exn/try: (action : () -> <exn|$14509> $14508, hndl : (exception) -> $14509 $14508) -> $14509 $14508( actionaction: () -> <exn|$14509> $14508, fnfn: (exception) -> $14509 $14508(_) { valuevalue: $14508 })

// Transform an `:error` type back to an `exn` effect.
pub fun untrystd/core/untry: forall<a> (err : error<a>) -> exn a( errerr: error<$11102> : errorstd/core/error: V -> V<aa: V> ) : exnstd/core/exn: HX aa: V
  match errerr: error<$11102>
    Errorstd/core/Error: forall<a> (exception : exception) -> error<a>(exnexn: exception) -> throw-exnstd/core/throw-exn: (exn : exception) -> exn $11102(exnexn: exception)
    Okstd/core/Ok: forall<a> (result : a) -> error<a>(xx: $11102)      -> xx: $11102

// Transform an `:error` type back to an `exn` effect.
pub fun exnstd/core/exn: forall<a> (err : error<a>) -> exn a( errerr: error<$11131> : errorstd/core/error: V -> V<aa: V> ) : exnstd/core/exn: HX aa: V
  untrystd/core/untry: (err : error<$11131>) -> exn $11131(errerr: error<$11131>)

// Use default value `def` in case of an error.
pub fun error/defaultstd/core/error/default: forall<a> (t : error<a>, def : a) -> a( tt: error<$3983> : errorstd/core/error: V -> V<aa: V>, defdef: $3983 : aa: V ) : astd/core/types/total: E
  match tt: error<$3983>
    Errorstd/core/Error: forall<a> (exception : exception) -> error<a>  -> defdef: $3983
    Okstd/core/Ok: forall<a> (result : a) -> error<a>(xx: $3983)  -> xx: $3983

// Transform an `:error` type to a `:maybe` value.
pub fun error/maybestd/core/error/maybe: forall<a> (t : error<a>) -> maybe<a>( tt: error<$4273> : errorstd/core/error: V -> V<aa: V> ) : maybestd/core/types/maybe: V -> V<aa: V>
  match tt: error<$4273>
    Errorstd/core/Error: forall<a> (exception : exception) -> error<a>  -> Nothingstd/core/types/Nothing: forall<a> maybe<a>
    Okstd/core/Ok: forall<a> (result : a) -> error<a>(xx: $4273)  -> Juststd/core/types/Just: forall<a> (value : a) -> maybe<a>(xx: $4273)

// Transform an `:error` type to an `:either` value.
pub fun error/eitherstd/core/error/either: forall<a> (t : error<a>) -> either<exception,a>( tt: error<$4600> : errorstd/core/error: V -> V<aa: V> ) : eitherstd/core/types/either: (V, V) -> V<exceptionstd/core/exception: V,aa: V>
  match tt: error<$4600>
    Errorstd/core/Error: forall<a> (exception : exception) -> error<a>(exnexn: exception) -> Leftstd/core/types/Left: forall<a,b> (left : a) -> either<a,b>(exnexn: exception)
    Okstd/core/Ok: forall<a> (result : a) -> error<a>(xx: $4600)      -> Rightstd/core/types/Right: forall<a,b> (right : b) -> either<a,b>(xx: $4600)

/*
// Set a `hndler` that is called only when an exception is raised in the `action` block.
pub fun on-exn( hndler : exception -> <exn|e> (), action : () -> <exn|e> a ) : <exn|e> a
  // prim-try-some( action, fn(exn){ hndler(exn); throw(exn) })
  match mask<exn>{ try(action) }
    TryOk(x)    { x
    TryExn(exn) { hndler(exn); throw(exn)

*/
// Set a `hndler` that is always called when the `action` finishes (either normally or with an exception).
pub fun on-exitstd/core/on-exit: forall<a,e> (hndler : () -> e (), action : () -> e a) -> e a( hndlerhndler: () -> $4076 () : () -> ee: E (std/core/types/unit: V)std/core/types/unit: V, actionaction: () -> $4076 $4075 : () -> ee: E aa: V ) : ee: E aa: V
  finallystd/core/hnd/finally: (fin : () -> $4076 (), action : () -> $4076 $4075) -> $4076 $4075(hndlerhndler: () -> $4076 (),actionaction: () -> $4076 $4075)

// ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
// Null is used for external interfaces
// ----------------------------------------------------------------------------

// Abstract type used for passing `null` values to external functions
pub type nullstd/core/null: V -> V<aa: V>

// Unsafe: transform any type to a `null` type; used internally by the compiler.
pub extern "@null-any"(xx: $2280 : aa: V) : nullstd/core/null: V -> V<aa: V>
  c  inline "(kk_box_is_null(#1) ? kk_datatype_null() : kk_datatype_unbox(#1))"
  cs inline "#1"
  js inline "(#1==null ? null : #1)"  // undefined -> null

// Transform a `:maybe` type to a `:null` type (using `null` for `Nothing`).
pub extern maybe/nullstd/core/maybe/null: forall<a> (x : maybe<a>) -> null<a>(xx: maybe<$4583> : maybestd/core/types/maybe: V -> V<aa: V>) : nullstd/core/null: V -> V<aa: V>
  c  inline "(kk_std_core_types__is_Nothing(#1,kk_context()) ? kk_datatype_null() : kk_datatype_unbox((#1)._cons.Just.value) /* kk_datatype_unbox(kk_datatype_unjust(#1,kk_context())) */ )"
  cs inline "(#1.tag_ == __std_core._maybe_Tag.Nothing ? default(##1) : #1.@value)"
  js inline "(#1==null ? null : #1.value)"

// Transform a `:null` type to a `:maybe` type. Note that it is not
// always the case that `id(x) == maybe(null(x))` (e.g. when `x = Just(Nothing)`).
pub extern null/maybestd/core/null/maybe: forall<a> (n : null<a>) -> maybe<a>( nn: null<$4360> : nullstd/core/null: V -> V<aa: V> ) : maybestd/core/types/maybe: V -> V<aa: V>
  c  inline "(kk_datatype_is_null(#1) ? kk_std_core_types__new_Nothing(kk_context()) : kk_std_core_types__new_Just(kk_datatype_box(#1),kk_context()))"
  cs inline "(EqualityComparer<##1>.Default.Equals(#1,default(##1)) ? __std_core._maybe<##1>.Nothing_ : new __std_core._maybe<##1>(#1))"
  js inline "(#1==null ? $std_core_types.Nothing : $std_core_types.Just(#1))"

// Cast a integer that is zero to a null
pub fun int/nullstd/core/int/null: (i : int) -> null<int>( ii: int : intstd/core/types/int: V ) : nullstd/core/null: V -> V<intstd/core/types/int: V>
    ii: int.maybestd/core/maybe: (i : int) -> maybe<int>.nullstd/core/maybe/null: (x : maybe<int>) -> null<int>

// Cast an empty string a null
pub fun string/nullstd/core/string/null: (s : string) -> null<string>( ss: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V ) : nullstd/core/null: V -> V<stringstd/core/types/string: V>
    ss: string.maybestd/core/string/maybe: (s : string) -> maybe<string>.nullstd/core/maybe/null: (x : maybe<string>) -> null<string>

// Cast a boolean `False` to null
pub fun bool/nullstd/core/bool/null: (b : bool) -> null<()>( bb: bool : boolstd/core/types/bool: V ) : nullstd/core/null: V -> V<(std/core/types/unit: V)std/core/types/unit: V>
    bb: bool.maybestd/core/bool/maybe: (b : bool) -> maybe<()>.nullstd/core/maybe/null: (x : maybe<()>) -> null<()>

// val null-const : forall<a> null<a> = null(Nothing)

// ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
// Main

// Used by the compiler to wrap main console applications
pub extern main-consolestd/core/main-console: forall<a,e> (main : () -> e a) -> e a : forall<aa: V,ee: E> ( main : () -> ee: E aa: V ) -> ee: E aa: V
  c "kk_main_console"
  cs inline "Primitive.MainConsole<##1>(#1)"
  js inline "(#1)()"

  inline "#1"

// Assign to an entry in a local `:vector` variable.
pub inline extern array/indexstd/core/array/index: forall<a,e,h> (self : local-var<h,vector<a>>, index : int, assigned : a) -> <local<h>,exn|e> ()( ^self : local-varstd/core/types/local-var: (H, V) -> V<ss: H,vectorstd/core/types/vector: V -> V<aa: V>>, ^index : intstd/core/types/int: V, assigned : aa: V ) : <localstd/core/types/local: H -> X<ss: H>,exnstd/core/exn: HX|std/core/types/effect-extend: (X, E) -> Eee: E> (std/core/types/unit: V)std/core/types/unit: V
  c  "kk_ref_vector_assign_borrow"
  cs inline "(#1)[(int)#2] = #3"
  js inline "(#1)[#2] = #3"

// Given a total function to calculate a value `:a`, return
// a total function that only calculates the value once and then
// returns the cached result.
pub fun oncestd/core/once: forall<a> (calc : () -> a) -> (() -> a)( calccalc: () -> $4099 : () -> astd/core/types/total: E ) : ((std/core/types/total: E) -> astd/core/types/total: E)
  unsafe-totalstd/core/types/unsafe-total: (action : () -> <alloc<_4117>|_4118> (() -> $4099)) -> (() -> $4099)
    val rr: ref<_4117,maybe<$4099>> = refstd/core/types/ref: (value : maybe<$4099>) -> <alloc<_4117>|_4118> ref<_4117,maybe<$4099>>(Nothingstd/core/types/Nothing: forall<a> maybe<a>)
    returnreturn: () -> $4099 fnfn: () -> $4099()
      unsafe-totalstd/core/types/unsafe-total: (action : () -> <read<_4117>,write<_4117>,div|_4198> $4099) -> $4099

// ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
// Unsafe

// _Unsafe_. This function removes the exception effect (`:exn`) from the effect of an action
pub fun unsafe-no-exnstd/core/unsafe-no-exn: forall<a,e> (action : () -> <exn|e> a) -> e a( actionaction: () -> <exn|$4496> $4495 : () -> <exnstd/core/exn: HX|std/core/types/effect-extend: (X, E) -> Eee: E> aa: V ) : ee: E aa: V
  unsafe-totalstd/core/types/unsafe-total: (action : () -> <exn|$4496> $4495) -> $4496 $4495( actionaction: () -> <exn|$4496> $4495 )



// ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
// Non determinism

noinline val unique-countstd/core/unique-count: ref<global,int> : refstd/core/types/ref: (H, V) -> V<globalstd/core/types/global: H,intstd/core/types/int: V> = unsafe-totalstd/core/types/unsafe-total: (action : () -> <alloc<global>|_4490> ref<global,int>) -> ref<global,int>{ refstd/core/types/ref: (value : int) -> <alloc<global>|_4490> ref<global,int>(0) }

// Returns a unique integer (modulo 32-bits).
pub fun uniquestd/core/unique: () -> ndet int() : ndetstd/core/types/ndet: X intstd/core/types/int: V
  unsafe-totalstd/core/types/unsafe-total: (action : () -> <read<global>,write<global>|_14583> int) -> ndet int
    val uu: int = !std/core/types/ref/(!): (ref : ref<global,int>) -> <read<global>,write<global>|_14583> intunique-countstd/core/unique-count: ref<global,int>

    uu: int

// ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
// Control
// ----------------------------------------------------------------------------

// The `while` fun executes `action`  as long as `pred`  is `true`.
pub fun whilestd/core/while: forall<e> (predicate : () -> <div|e> bool, action : () -> <div|e> ()) -> <div|e> ()( predicatepredicate: () -> <div|$15551> bool : () -> <divstd/core/types/div: X|std/core/types/effect-extend: (X, E) -> Eee: E> boolstd/core/types/bool: V, actionaction: () -> <div|$15551> () : () -> <divstd/core/types/div: X|std/core/types/effect-extend: (X, E) -> Eee: E> (std/core/types/unit: V)std/core/types/unit: V ) : <divstd/core/types/div: X|std/core/types/effect-extend: (X, E) -> Eee: E> (std/core/types/unit: V)std/core/types/unit: V
  if predicatepredicate: () -> <div|$15551> bool() then
    actionaction: () -> <div|$15551> ()()
    whilestd/core/while: (predicate : () -> <div|$15551> bool, action : () -> <div|$15551> ()) -> <div|$15551> ()(predicatepredicate: () -> <div|$15551> bool, actionaction: () -> <div|$15551> ())std/core/types/Unit: ()

// The `repeat` fun executes `action`  `n`  times.
pub fun action/repeatstd/core/action/repeat: forall<e> (n : int, action : () -> e ()) -> e ()( ^nn: int : intstd/core/types/int: V, actionaction: () -> $6511 () : () -> ee: E (std/core/types/unit: V)std/core/types/unit: V ) : ee: E (std/core/types/unit: V)std/core/types/unit: V
  forstd/core/for: (start : int, end : int, action : (int) -> $6511 ()) -> $6511 ()(1,nn: int) fnfn: (i : int) -> $6511 ()(ii: int)
    actionaction: () -> $6511 ()()

// Executes `action`  for each integer between [`start`,`end`]  (including both `start`  and `end` ).
// If `start > end`  the function returns without any call to `action` .
pub fun forstd/core/for: forall<e> (start : int, end : int, action : (int) -> e ()) -> e ()( ^startstart: int: intstd/core/types/int: V, endend: int : intstd/core/types/int: V, actionaction: (int) -> $6468 () : (intstd/core/types/int: V) -> ee: E (std/core/types/unit: V)std/core/types/unit: V ) : ee: E (std/core/types/unit: V)std/core/types/unit: V
  fun reprep: (i : int) -> $6468 ()( ^ii: int : intstd/core/types/int: V )
    if ii: int <=std/core/int/(<=): (x : int, y : int) -> $6468 bool endend: int then
      actionaction: (int) -> $6468 ()(ii: int)
      reprep: (i : int) -> $6468 ()(unsafe-decreasingstd/core/types/unsafe-decreasing: (x : int) -> $6468 int(ii: int.incstd/core/int/inc: (i : int) -> $6468 int))std/core/types/Unit: ()
  reprep: (i : int) -> $6468 ()(startstart: int)

// Executes `action`  for each integer between [`start`,`end`]  (including both `start`  and `end` ).
// If `start > end`  the function returns without any call to `action` .
fun forzstd/core/forz: forall<e> (start : ssize_t, end : ssize_t, action : (ssize_t) -> e ()) -> e ()( startstart: ssize_t: ssize_tstd/core/types/ssize_t: V, endend: ssize_t : ssize_tstd/core/types/ssize_t: V, actionaction: (ssize_t) -> $8060 () : (ssize_tstd/core/types/ssize_t: V) -> ee: E (std/core/types/unit: V)std/core/types/unit: V ) : ee: E (std/core/types/unit: V)std/core/types/unit: V
  fun reprep: (i : ssize_t) -> $8060 ()( ii: ssize_t : ssize_tstd/core/types/ssize_t: V )
    if ii: ssize_t <=std/core/ssize_t/(<=): (ssize_t, ssize_t) -> $8060 bool endend: ssize_t then
      actionaction: (ssize_t) -> $8060 ()(ii: ssize_t)
      reprep: (i : ssize_t) -> $8060 ()(unsafe-decreasingstd/core/types/unsafe-decreasing: (x : ssize_t) -> $8060 ssize_t(ii: ssize_t.incrstd/core/ssize_t/incr: (i : ssize_t) -> $8060 ssize_t))std/core/types/Unit: ()
  reprep: (i : ssize_t) -> $8060 ()(startstart: ssize_t)

// Executes `action`  for each integer between `start`  upto `end`  (including both `start`  and `end` ).
// If `start > end`  the function returns without any call to `action` .
// If `action` returns `Just`, the iteration is stopped and the result returned
pub fun for-whilestd/core/for-while: forall<a,e> (start : int, end : int, action : (int) -> e maybe<a>) -> e maybe<a>( startstart: int: intstd/core/types/int: V, endend: int : intstd/core/types/int: V, actionaction: (int) -> $11679 maybe<$11678> : (intstd/core/types/int: V) -> ee: E maybestd/core/types/maybe: V -> V<aa: V> ) : ee: E maybestd/core/types/maybe: V -> V<aa: V>
  fun reprep: (i : int) -> $11679 maybe<$11678>( ii: int : intstd/core/types/int: V )
    if ii: int <=std/core/int/(<=): (x : int, y : int) -> $11679 bool endend: int then
      match actionaction: (int) -> $11679 maybe<$11678>(ii: int)
        Nothingstd/core/types/Nothing: forall<a> maybe<a> -> reprep: (i : int) -> $11679 maybe<$11678>(unsafe-decreasingstd/core/types/unsafe-decreasing: (x : int) -> $11679 int(ii: int.incstd/core/int/inc: (i : int) -> $11679 int))
        Juststd/core/types/Just: forall<a> (value : a) -> maybe<a>(xx: $11678) -> Juststd/core/types/Just: forall<a> (value : a) -> maybe<a>(xx: $11678)
    else Nothingstd/core/types/Nothing: forall<a> maybe<a>
  reprep: (i : int) -> $11679 maybe<$11678>(startstart: int)

// Executes `action`  for each integer between `start`  upto `end`  (including both `start`  and `end` ).
// If `start > end`  the function returns without any call to `action` .
// If `action` returns `Just`, the iteration is stopped and the result returned
fun for-whilezstd/core/for-whilez: forall<a,e> (start : ssize_t, end : ssize_t, action : (ssize_t) -> e maybe<a>) -> e maybe<a>( startstart: ssize_t: ssize_tstd/core/types/ssize_t: V, endend: ssize_t : ssize_tstd/core/types/ssize_t: V, actionaction: (ssize_t) -> $7699 maybe<$7698> : (ssize_tstd/core/types/ssize_t: V) -> ee: E maybestd/core/types/maybe: V -> V<aa: V> ) : ee: E maybestd/core/types/maybe: V -> V<aa: V>
  fun reprep: (i : ssize_t) -> $7699 maybe<$7698>( ii: ssize_t : ssize_tstd/core/types/ssize_t: V )
    if ii: ssize_t <=std/core/ssize_t/(<=): (ssize_t, ssize_t) -> $7699 bool endend: ssize_t then
      match actionaction: (ssize_t) -> $7699 maybe<$7698>(ii: ssize_t)
        Nothingstd/core/types/Nothing: forall<a> maybe<a> -> reprep: (i : ssize_t) -> $7699 maybe<$7698>(unsafe-decreasingstd/core/types/unsafe-decreasing: (x : ssize_t) -> $7699 ssize_t(ii: ssize_t.incrstd/core/ssize_t/incr: (i : ssize_t) -> $7699 ssize_t))
        Juststd/core/types/Just: forall<a> (value : a) -> maybe<a>(xx: $7698) -> Juststd/core/types/Just: forall<a> (value : a) -> maybe<a>(xx: $7698)
    else Nothingstd/core/types/Nothing: forall<a> maybe<a>
  reprep: (i : ssize_t) -> $7699 maybe<$7698>(startstart: ssize_t)

// Return the host environment: `dotnet`, `browser`, `webworker`, `node`, or `libc`.
pub extern hoststd/core/host: () -> ndet string() : ndetstd/core/types/ndet: X stringstd/core/types/string: V
  c "kk_get_host"
  cs inline "\"dotnet\""
  js inline "_host"

/*
// .open is used in the compiler to open up closed effects.
// Usually simplified away but still present if --no-simplify flag is given
pub inline extern ".open"<e1 :: E, e2 :: E, a, b>( x : a ) : total b
  inline "#1"
*/

// Magic casting to the `:any` type.
pub inline extern "@toany"( x : aa: V ) : anystd/core/types/any: V
  inline "#1"
  cs inline "(object)(#1)"

// Internal: used for value effects
// TODO: revisit value effects codegen
pub alias valuestd/core/value: V -> V<aa: V> = aa: V

// Internal: used for value effects
// TODO: revisit value effects codegen
pub extern phantomstd/core/phantom: forall<a> () -> a<aa: V>() : astd/core/types/total: E
  c inline "kk_box_null()"
  inline "undefined"


// ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
// File locations
// ------------------------------------------------------------------------------

// Compilation constant that is replaced with the current file's module name
pub val file/kk-modulestd/core/file/kk-module: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V = ""

// Compilation constant that is replaced with the current line number
pub val file/kk-linestd/core/file/kk-line: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V = ""

// Compilation constant that is replaced with the current file name
pub val file/kk-filestd/core/file/kk-file: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V = ""

pub fun file/kk-file-linestd/core/file/kk-file-line: (@implicit/kk-file : string, @implicit/kk-line : string) -> string( @implicit/kk-file@implicit/kk-file: string, @implicit/kk-line@implicit/kk-line: string )
  @implicit/kk-file@implicit/kk-file: string ++std/core/string/(++): (x : string, y : string) -> string "(line " ++std/core/string/(++): (x : string, y : string) -> string @implicit/kk-line@implicit/kk-line: string ++std/core/string/(++): (x : string, y : string) -> string ")"

// ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
// Trace, assert, todo
// ----------------------------------------------------------------------------

extern xtracestd/core/xtrace: (message : string) -> () : ( message : stringstd/core/types/string: V ) -> (std/core/types/unit: V)std/core/types/unit: V
  c  "kk_trace"
  cs "Primitive.Trace"
  js "_trace"

extern xtrace-anystd/core/xtrace-any: forall<a> (message : string, x : a) -> () : forall<aa: V> ( message: stringstd/core/types/string: V, x : aa: V ) -> (std/core/types/unit: V)std/core/types/unit: V
  c  "kk_trace_any"
  cs "Primitive.TraceAny"
  js "_trace_any"

val trace-enabledstd/core/trace-enabled: ref<global,bool> : refstd/core/types/ref: (H, V) -> V<globalstd/core/types/global: H,boolstd/core/types/bool: V> = unsafe-totalstd/core/types/unsafe-total: (action : () -> <alloc<global>|_4032> ref<global,bool>) -> ref<global,bool>{ refstd/core/types/ref: (value : bool) -> <alloc<global>|_4032> ref<global,bool>(Truestd/core/types/True: bool) }

// Trace a message used for debug purposes.
// The behaviour is system dependent. On a browser and node it uses
// `console.log`  by default.
// Disabled if `notrace` is called.
pub fun tracestd/core/trace: (message : string) -> ()( messagemessage: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V ) : (std/core/types/unit: V)std/core/types/unit: V
  unsafe-totalstd/core/types/unsafe-total: (action : () -> <read<global>|_14367> ()) -> ()
    if !std/core/types/ref/(!): (ref : ref<global,bool>) -> <read<global>|_14367> booltrace-enabledstd/core/trace-enabled: ref<global,bool> then xtracestd/core/xtrace: (message : string) -> <read<global>|_14367> ()(messagemessage: string)std/core/types/Unit: ()

pub fun trace-infostd/core/trace-info: (message : string, @implicit/kk-file-line : string) -> ()( messagemessage: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V, @implicit/kk-file-line@implicit/kk-file-line: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V ) : (std/core/types/unit: V)std/core/types/unit: V
  tracestd/core/trace: (message : string) -> ()(@implicit/kk-file-line@implicit/kk-file-line: string ++std/core/string/(++): (x : string, y : string) -> string ": " ++std/core/string/(++): (x : string, y : string) -> string messagemessage: string)

pub fun trace-showstd/core/trace-show: forall<a> (x : a, @implicit/show : (a) -> string, @implicit/kk-file-line : string) -> ()( xx: $14464 : aa: V, @implicit/show@implicit/show: ($14464) -> string : aa: V -> stringstd/core/types/string: V, @implicit/kk-file-line@implicit/kk-file-line: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V ) : (std/core/types/unit: V)std/core/types/unit: V
  trace-infostd/core/trace-info: (message : string, @implicit/kk-file-line : string) -> ()
?kk-file-line=?kk-file-line(xx: $14464.show@implicit/show: ($14464) -> string)

pub fun trace-anystd/core/trace-any: forall<a> (message : string, x : a) -> ()( messagemessage: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V, xx: $14386 : aa: V ) : (std/core/types/unit: V)std/core/types/unit: V
  unsafe-totalstd/core/types/unsafe-total: (action : () -> <read<global>|_14412> ()) -> ()
    if !std/core/types/ref/(!): (ref : ref<global,bool>) -> <read<global>|_14412> booltrace-enabledstd/core/trace-enabled: ref<global,bool> then xtrace-anystd/core/xtrace-any: (message : string, x : $14386) -> <read<global>|_14412> ()(messagemessage: string,xx: $14386)std/core/types/Unit: ()

// Disable tracing completely.
pub noinline fun notracestd/core/notrace: () -> (st<global>) ()() : ststd/core/types/st: H -> E<globalstd/core/types/global: H> (std/core/types/unit: V)std/core/types/unit: V
  trace-enabledstd/core/trace-enabled: ref<global,bool> :=std/core/types/set: (ref : ref<global,bool>, assigned : bool) -> <write<global>,alloc<global>,read<global>> () Falsestd/core/types/False: bool

extern unsafe-assert-failstd/core/unsafe-assert-fail: (msg : string) -> ()( msgmsg: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V ) : (std/core/types/unit: V)std/core/types/unit: V
  c "kk_assert_fail"
  js inline "function() { throw new Error(\"assertion failed: \" + #1) }()"

pub fun assertstd/core/assert: (message : string, condition : bool, @implicit/kk-file-line : string) -> ()( messagemessage: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V, conditioncondition: bool : boolstd/core/types/bool: V, @implicit/kk-file-line@implicit/kk-file-line: string : stringstd/core/types/string: V ) : (std/core/types/unit: V)std/core/types/unit: V   // Compiler removes assert calls in optimized builds
  if !std/core/types/bool/(!): (b : bool) -> boolconditioncondition: bool then unsafe-assert-failstd/core/unsafe-assert-fail: (msg : string) -> ()(kk-file-line@implicit/kk-file-line: string ++std/core/string/(++): (x : string, y : string) -> string ": " ++std/core/string/(++): (x : string, y : string) -> string messagemessage: string)std/core/types/Unit: ()
